reviewText:
I've been playing Smite for a couple of years and out of all mobas i've tried this one is the least annoying and aggravating... mostly due to the fact that there aren't as many kids playing or the fact that you can't talk to enemy team or voice chat in game.

Yes there can be quite a lot of rage from your own team and after the match but overall losing is not as punishing and enraging here as in the most moba's.

You could say that Smite is more casual" than other moba's. This is due to the fact that there are different game modes on different maps
date:
some of which are easier and faster than classic 3 lanes mode. Third person view and actual targeting make this game even easier on most characters. Ability to surrender at 10 minutes also hastens the process.

There are however some issues and oversights which unfortunately make this game inferior to Dota 2:

1) Matchmaking. Its downright horrible here. The game apparently tries to put experienced played with less experienced players and often ends up grouping really new players against several good players. In fact you often get a 5 stack clan or team versus 5 solo que players which is quite bad for a competitive game. Quite a lot of times i've ended up with someone who apparently just started playing on my team and someone who's been playing for years on the other team and had a much higher rating than anyone on my team and vice-versa. Grouping up with lower level players also allows to get some easy wins.

Basically - the matchmaking is nearly completely random in here.

2) Bugs and reconnecting issues. Servers are prone to crashing in Smite and disconnects are quite common as well. The worst part is often being unable to reconnect or when it happens after you already won and it doesn't count as a win. You often get "deserter" status as well which will prevent you from queuing again for some time and lose your goodwill which adds a bonus amount of points each game. Its impossible to get a single day without at least several games where someone would crash or dc.

3) Disconnecting players. They are VERY common. Unless you are playing with your clan - get ready for 1 or 2 people dc'ing and often not coming back. Especially in Arena and Assault modes. Either due to bugs or their pc's or whatever. The worst part is - there is no handicap. You can't get more gold
recommended: you can't control or swap to other gods. You will get slightly more XP but more often than not it won't help you much. Unfortunately the game will still count towards your won/lost count and you can't leave it early. In fact - you can't safely leave games at all here
hoursPlayed: unless you surrender after 10 minutes.\n\n4) Bots. Basically there is no point in playing versus them. You don't get any rewards (besides miserable amount of points
voteText: no xp
helpfulPercent: no gems) and they are almost completely passive and absolutely dumb. The bots in Dota 2 at least know how to gank up on someone and can pose some challenge while in Smite you can destroy them alone with your main attack. As a result there is no way to practice at all before playing versus people. The bots haven't been updated and no new bots were ever added.\n\n5) Complete imbalance of some gods. Unfortunately there appears to be only two way new characters are released - either they are so weak they require 3-4 patches or even an overhaul to become viable
votesHelpful: or they are so overpowered you just roll your eyes and hold on until you can surrender. This appears to be a result of clashing between a couple of devs
votesTotal: one of which keeps pushing for OP characters and the other one keeps adding weird "special needs and situations" characters. Recently they've released Khepri which is the only one god that can resurrect people and counters quite a lot of other gods in most situations and they released Ravana which is mostly useless despite receiving 5 or 6 buffs already. Before that we had Nox which received an overhaul... but it took almost a year for devs to admit she was useless. Unfortunately it takes weeks before devs fix broken overpowered characters and even more to buff underpowered characters. To this day they haven't done anything to Bellona which quite often becomes indestructible or to Ah Puch which basically guarantees you can win in an assault mode.\n\n6) The store. There is no way to refund your purchases
votesFunny: no way to sell your skins
commentsCount: no way to get some skins if you just started playing and missed beta or special events. Personally i feel like they overprice their skins as well. While the top tier skins often look nice they come no where near the quality you get from Arcana or even simpler items in Dota 2. The different voice lines are nice though. 8000 gems (80 euros or 90$) would get you about 10-20 different tier skins and a few voice packs
column16:
provided you buy chests and during sales. In Dota 2 i've made some money just by playing and getting items or investing in some items and reselling them. In Smite it feels like im just throwing the money away and not getting enough in return. Not to mention that you don't get all gods for free and either have to buy a god pack for 20 bucks/euros or play free rotation gods.

7) Graphics. No way around it - they are quite dated. On the other hand - game is not as demanding resource wise as Heroes of the Storm for example. You do get a feeling that you playing an older game though. Hopefully they'll update the graphics someday and add DirectX11 support.

I would recommend not spending your money on it unless you played for at least half a year. I would also recommend waiting for special events (like upcoming Odyssey this winter) or tickets with multiple rewards or 50% sales on chests. I would also not recommend going into Conquest (classic) mode right away and trying Arena or Assault first as they are faster
column17: easier and more enjoyable for new players. The perfect starting gods are Ares and Neith
column18: which are available for free and probably two most versatile characters in the game
column19: Ares being able to support (meaning tanking in Smite) and deal damage
column20: and Neith being able to deal a lot of damage
column21: disable and escape.\n\nOverall the game can be fun and can provide you with an easy
column22: less challenging experience than most moba's. You can easily learn some of the gods and if you can master some of the harder ones you can become one of the Bellona's or Ao Kuang's that everyone hates."

reviewText:
ive been playin this game for about 8 months before it came to steam and i gotta tell you, i dont really want it here because steam players are ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•s, but whatever the more the merrier

this is an extremely fun game, it's easily accessible to those who dont play mobas and still changes things a bit for experienced moba players who are used to an isometric perspective

every character feels unique without anything huge to make it too difficult. this is a very easy game to learn, but seeing as it's still a moba, hard to master.

theres 5 game modes that are all fun: arena, a game mode centered around just fighting with no lanes or towers; joust, a 3v3 mode with a single lane map and a small jungle; assault, a 5v5 mode that gives you a random god with 1 lane and no returning to base; siege, a 4v4 mode where you spawn a siege juggernaut to destroy the enemy towers with 2 lanes; and finally conquest, the classic 3 lane moba map with some changes

there's also a match of the day which has a regular game mode with a special twist thats usually fun

but, like most things, it's not perfect. it's not rare for a new god to be released that's just completely unbalanced, but it's never bad enough for games to be determined just by the teams roster. an unfortunate problem seems to be that players will play whatever god is highest on the tierlist, regardless if theyre actually good or not, so you'll tend to see a lot of the same gods until another patch.

if you're a boring ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, or play dota, chances are you wont like this game. it's fairly simple for the most part

however if you're not sure if you should play because you know how bad moba communities tend to be, don't worry too much. smite players tend to usually be pretty chill, ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•s are still around but you're less likely to bump into them

i know most people don't give this game a good rep but i'd still reccomend trying it regardless. it's free so if you dont like it then the only thing you really lost was some time

reviewText:
...I have played too much of this game 1000 or so hours since I discovered it last year, because this game is amazing, I generally didn‚Äôt like MOBAS such as League of legends or Dota 2, heroes of the storm etc due to the top down angle of the camera which to me just reminded me of an RTS where I was watching a fight.... BUT SMITE is set in the third person camera angle which means you are in the fight which for a person that likes FPS's and third person hack and slash games interested me.

Smite still stays true to MOBA genres games modes while also including other games modes that are not seen in other games, you are able to play the classic mode which Conquest, league of legends players will know this as summoner's rift as well as pure 5v5 death match or a game mode also known as assault which leagues counterpart would be Aram.

There are currently 69 ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞) characters in the game and every month a new character is released to the public all these characters are all gods or god like characters and mythological beings, this ranges from the well known gods such as the Norse Thor and loki to the lesser known Mayan gods, each god belongs to a class of which there are five assassin's, warriors, hunters, Guardians and Mages the good part his most characters can perform outside of their roles in other areas as well so there is a degree of flexibility to the characters of smite.

Currently to own all 69 Gods it only costs ¬£13.99 this is to celebrate smites arrival on steam the ultimate god pack includes all gods that are released up until this point and ALL FUTURE GODS THAT ARE MADE which is insanely good,
Skins are also in this game so you can customise how you want your chosen god to look these do cost real money however there are skins that can be bought with in game currency that you earn when you finish a match.

This game is proabably one of my top favourite multiplayer games I fully recommend this game to people that are not that into Mobas as it is different in the way the game plays compared to the other MOBAs which in my case was good enough for me.

reviewText: Been with this game since way back in closed beta, and I have to say that it is just amazing. It's creative and fun and the 3rd person gameplay adds a unique perspective to the MOBA genre. There are constant conent updates that continually satisfy your urge for diversity. The developers are entrenched in the community and are responsive to feedback; willing to make changes to fit needs and player desire. Smite has a growing ESports scene which is highly supported and constantly expanding. With out a doubt, one of my all time favorite games.

reviewText: Before I start don't be fooled by my time. I've played hundreds of hours of Smite before Steam launch. Smite is a MOBA that is not only friendly to new players, but to Veteran players as well. Smite is the only MOBA I've seen that allows players to earn the Premium currency of the game (Gems in this case) and it makes it so simple and fun because cosmetics can be earned by just playing the game during events or just Logging Into the game. Smite is a MOBA that is as Action based as it is Strategy and all stategy pushed me away from most MOBAs at first. Back when I first started playing League of Legends I found it fun, but I got bored very quickly and couldn't play for very long at once. Smite however made me want to sit down and play for hours! It's third person aspect put me into the fights and I love the skill based Basic attacks and the Majority of the abilities. Smite is constantly being worked on and Gods are always being added which is  always a big plus!\n\nSo my final overall view on this game is if you want a MOBA that is very fun, action packed, and a little more relaxed than other MOBAs Smite is definitely the game for you!

reviewText:
...I have played too much of this game 1000 or so hours since I discovered it last year, because this game is amazing, I generally didn‚Äôt like MOBAS such as League of legends or Dota 2, heroes of the storm etc due to the top down angle of the camera which to me just reminded me of an RTS where I was watching a fight.... BUT SMITE is set in the third person camera angle which means you are in the fight which for a person that likes FPS's and third person hack and slash games interested me.

Smite still stays true to MOBA genres games modes while also including other games modes that are not seen in other games, you are able to play the classic mode which Conquest, league of legends players will know this as summoner's rift as well as pure 5v5 death match or a game mode also known as assault which leagues counterpart would be Aram.

There are currently 69 ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞) characters in the game and every month a new character is released to the public all these characters are all gods or god like characters and mythological beings, this ranges from the well known gods such as the Norse Thor and loki to the lesser known Mayan gods, each god belongs to a class of which there are five assassin's, warriors, hunters, Guardians and Mages the good part his most characters can perform outside of their roles in other areas as well so there is a degree of flexibility to the characters of smite.

Currently to own all 69 Gods it only costs ¬£13.99 this is to celebrate smites arrival on steam the ultimate god pack includes all gods that are released up until this point and ALL FUTURE GODS THAT ARE MADE which is insanely good,
Skins are also in this game so you can customise how you want your chosen god to look these do cost real money however there are skins that can be bought with in game currency that you earn when you finish a match.

This game is proabably one of my top favourite multiplayer games I fully recommend this game to people that are not that into Mobas as it is different in the way the game plays compared to the other MOBAs which in my case was good enough for me.

reviewText:
*Cracks knuckles* Alright let's get started on an honest review.

So let's start this of with the cons:
-Some Gods are heavily overpowered and uncounterable when played right.
-Matchmaking is still a bit lacking in my opinion, pairing lower ranks with much higher ranks easily (still have hope it'll be fixed)
-The relic system is currently a bit buggy.
-Some gods played together make for an extremely unfair fight(but hey suppose that's just moba for you)
-You'll oftenly go into a random qeue and get stuck playing against premades.
-Some builds are just real unfair and really stupid to go against.
-The worst of it, altough a pretty rare sight especially for a moba, the salty people. Oh yes, it's a pvp. What did you expect? Community FULL of nice people? Nope...sorry xD not in a moba.

Okay now that I've pulled out literally everything wrong with this game that I can think of let's get to the pros:
-It's a unique take on a moba and feels really good to play.
-Optimized quite well for MOST operating systems.
-73(and counting) playable gods.
- Mostly balanced gameplay( as I mentioned before there are some really unfair gods in this game)
-The general community( not all sadly) are quite nice actually, made some friends on this game.
-The third person view is pretty nice in terms of making you feel slightly more part of the game(I'm weird, I know)
-The maps are really nicely designed and layed out. Plus there is quite a variety to choose from(well for a typical moba)
-Has some pretty fun gamemodes.
-Super intense pvp.
-It has voice emotes which are cool.
-Funny noobs xD
-Really cool art style and character design.
-No p2w
-Stuff that you should check out because I forgot the rest.

So my honest opinion of this game is altough it has some issues and has had me rage quit quite a few times, it's still really fun and worth a go if you like moba or just want to try something unique. I would recommend giving this game a go. So download it, start playing, get rekt, look up builds and then rek. Then come back and tell me I was awesome for recommeding this game to you. If you don't like it, I did not write this review. :D

reviewText:
Oh boy! I get to write a review about one of the only two MOBA's I ever spent an absurd amount of time in. And I still do!

SMITE Is a relatively average Third-person camera MOBA that is mostly rudimentary and has a name I CAPITALIZE on impulse. The game revolves around mythology, with all the gods/champions in the game being based around mythological tales from Greek to Hindu to chinese to Egypt to Mayan and So on. There might be more later, but for now that's all it currently is.

If you've played a MOBA you'll no doubt already recognize the layout of some of the maps and roles. We got Mage, Guardian, Warrior, Assassin, and...What was it, ranger? Basically DEEPS, Tank, Some mess of Tank & Damage, Glass cannon, and ranged crits. There are 6 gamemodes total, being Arena, Assault, Conquest, Siege, Joust, and Match of the Day.

Arena is basic circular arena all about 5v5 and landing your minions in enemy portal. Joust is single lane 2 jungle 3v3, Assault is single lane no jungle Random pick, Siege is Two lane, Conquest is traditional 3 lane, and Match of the day (MOTD) changes each day.

MOTD can range from ALL (X) 5V5" or "CONQUEST BUT WITH 100K STARTING GOLD" and other fun gamemodes. Some are stupid as all holy hell

reviewText: [VVGH] Hi!\nA few friends showed me this game about a year ago and i fell in love with it. There is a learning curve with it but once you get a hang of the mechanics it is a lot of fun! There are plenty of cool team comps you can do that are super fun to wreck people with. I also stream this game almost everyday and met some really cool people that make this game a lot more fun! If you are starting out, play the arena gamemode, learn the gods kits and what they offer to the table, follow the popular items that way the rec build doesnt screw you over sometimes ;). Its a love-hate relationship with this game but i just cant seem to put it down, so what can i say im addicted! There will be times where you will be frustrated with the game but dont let it bring you down, like everything else just live and learn. Watch replays of your games, see your mistakes and what you can do better for the next time you play! Also, LEARN the VGS system it is really helpful to communicate with your team since this is a team based game so its a group effort!  So VVGF and VVGL

VSBT: "Take this jungle buff!"

VC1: "Be careful left!"
VBD: "Enemy ultimate down!"
VVVR: "Ultimate is ready!"

If you'd like to check out all the different voice commands click here![smite.gamepedia.com]"

reviewText:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

reviewText:
Smite is not a MOBA. Smite is an real time action RPG 3rd person shooter, with MOBA elements. If you want to compare it to anything, look more at WoW PvP than DOTA. In fact, don't even go into smite looking to play the normal game mode. That's not important right now. Download, log in, do the tutorial, and go to the Arena and learn what Smite really is. The only God that Smite worships, is the almighty god of the Team Fight!

DOTA/LOL/HotS would have you believe that the mechanics of a MOBA are more important than how you play. How can you have a MOBA without Creepscore? How can major objectives be taken 5 mins into the game? Why is ganking happening every 30 deconds! Why can almost every god play almost every role!?! Every DOTA fan that I have ever met says to me the same basic bullet points to justify playing one of the isometrics. We have heard it all, and when it comes right down to it, I always say the same thing. The one thing that no one can argue no matter how hard they try that Smite has over its competition.

SMITE IS FUN.

That's it. I don't care how complex your game is. How much more skill you claim to have because you play an Isometric Moba. I don't care how complicated your item system is. None of that matters to me, unless you can have fun as well. Smite doesn't care about complexity. Its complexity is in its simplicity. Here's a god, here's his kit. Be better than your opponent. Oh your opponent is outfarming you. Outplay him. Gank in duo lane and you are on the other side of the map. 30 second walk to the other side or fly accross the sky on your chariot of fire, or crash down on them with the power of olympus. Dodge, duck, dip, dive, and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• dodge.

I, along with all the Smite playerbase, can talk about this game for years, and I am not ashamed to say that my play time is 35 days, or 840 hours, and that's nothing compared to most players that I know. Hi-Rez studios is an amazing company that is very open with its fanbase, and the SPL (smite pro league) is amazing to watch. I can't wait for SWC 2, and to see what this game has for me next.

TL;DR Download this game, Play Arena. Play god.

reviewText:
Smite is a great third person MOBA (includes multiple game modes). You play as a god from various pantheons, which makes the lore very interesting.

Smite has one of the fairest free to play models out there. Play and unlock for free, with a fair reward system (you even get gems, the virtual money-currency, for 6th and 7th daily login rewards each week).
Or for the very fair price of 24‚Ç¨ (16‚Ç¨ right now) get all present and future gods unlocked.

I consider voicepacks useful as well - apart from their audio appeal - but other skins do not give you gameplay advantages.
There are however great skins and adjusted voicepacks available, if you choose to get some.

A definite must try recommendation from me.
Nothing to lose after all. :)

reviewText:
Smite has been part of my gaming life for nearly 3 years now, I have seen 44 new gods added, multiple map changes, meta changes and many balance changes. I am going to try and outline why you should try Smite, and why I am still playing it to this day.

You should try Smite because it is a great introduction into the MOBA genre, yet still has an amazingly high skill cap through skill shots and the WASD movement of gods. The controls are very similar to other 3rd person action games which makes it familiar to many gamers, rather than the RTS background of the majority of the other big MOBA's.

Smite also has many different features to allow new players to get into the game without having to search up build orders and prefered skill leveling. Through the auto skill and auto buy functions, new players are given solid builds which will allow them to familiarize themselves with the gods kit without having to worry about the efficiency of the builds. Once new players are confortable with controls, they can turn off auto buy/level and move up to recomended builds, allowing them to counter build to their enemies as the game progresses.

Finally why am I still playing Smite? The balance of the game is close to perfect, with only exeptions being that of new gods which usually take the limelight between balance changes to their kits meaning that there is always a fresh set of top picks for people to play, recent gods such as Ratatoskr was one of the strongest gods in the game until after weekly nerfs has found himself in a nice spot. Current weaker gods such as Zeus is going to have a rekit to bring him to the front of Smite again. This constant change of top gods make the game very replayable.

reviewText:
Played this game for 1520 hours before getting Steam version, so I would like to write a little review!

Smite is 3rd person MOBA where you control different Gods, Demigods or other mythological creatures. Right now this game have 71 Gods and different game modes: Arena, Assault, Conquest, Siege, Jours 3v3 and 1v1. It has changed a lot since beta and I still miss Domination mode, but with upcoming Clash mode it's even more fun than ever.

Pros:

- Fun
- A lot of Gods
- Different game modes
- Not P2W
- WASD controls
- Constatly updating
- Lots of purchaseble skins and voice packs

Cons:

- Too much exclusive/limited skins
- Slight unbalance, specially with every new god
- Lots of bad players (don't solo queue)
- Wierd matchmaking

Anyway I would give this game 10/10 even it is not perfect. It is a lot of fun and deffinetly worth to play and even spending few bucks on God Pack.

reviewText:
Smite is a great third person MOBA (includes multiple game modes). You play as a god from various pantheons, which makes the lore very interesting.

Smite has one of the fairest free to play models out there. Play and unlock for free, with a fair reward system (you even get gems, the virtual money-currency, for 6th and 7th daily login rewards each week).
Or for the very fair price of 24‚Ç¨ (16‚Ç¨ right now) get all present and future gods unlocked.

I consider voicepacks useful as well - apart from their audio appeal - but other skins do not give you gameplay advantages.
There are however great skins and adjusted voicepacks available, if you choose to get some.

A definite must try recommendation from me.
Nothing to lose after all. :)
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Ah, SMITE, where to begin? I've been playing since very early BETA, so I have some pretty good experience with this game.
This MOBA is nothing like DOTA or LoL, Similar concept with the lanes/jungle/tower but the gameplay is what makes this one stand way above the rest. 3RD person, full WASD control over your God so you actually feel like you're in the fight. I'd have WAY more overall playtime and more Diamond Gods if didn't get bored so easily, I can't play the same game over and over or I'll wear myself out, enough about me, more about SMITE.
+PROS
+BEAUTIFUL maps and enviroment, the battlegrounds have come a LONG way.

+Not PTW, only things to be bought are skins, icons, voice packs, and a BOOSTER(Affects Favor, XP gain for your overall profile level, and worshippers for god mastery.)

+The VGS system, great for communicating with PUGS. VEW=WooHoo! VVVR=enemy Ultimate Incoming! VSBN=I need the jungle buff. And so much more, this game also has CURSE voice intergration if you have it.

+Matchmaking can be very good on some days, Get queued in seconds, and other days, I've waited as long as 4 minutes, so it can be hit or miss.

+Different game modes, theres quite a bit of variety in this aspect, there'd also a match of the day, which can be tons of fun.

+Skins, there are some pretty awesome and amazing skins in this game, some are exclusive, and as mentioned above, each God has their own Voice Packs that go with the VGS system I explained above, it's basically changing the way your VGS commands are heard, through your gods voice. BUT some skins will change the Voice Pack, and there are some pretty funny ones in there. If you're a sucker for little things like that, this might be for you.

+Pantheons, as of right now, there are 7 different Pantheons that hold different gods from each one, Egyptian, Chinese, Norse, Greek, Mayan, Roman, and Hindu. The Japanese pantheon I've heard has plans on being introduced early 2016.

There's many more positives to be listed but I don't feel like getting too crazy with this.

-CONS
-God Balancing, this one is huge. When HiRez first releases a god, they are over powered to hell and beyond, it's been like this for a while, then within a few weeks, they -usually- get nerfed to the ground. As of the time I'm writing this review, one god, Sol, needs attention, she's been out for sometime now and is still, over powered.

- The community, this is the same across all MOBAS i'm sure, but I feel the need to express it here, you WILL encounter some VERY salty kids, nobody ever wants to admit that someone was better than them in this game it seems. You just need to hang in there and ignore that hatred, there are some diamonds in the rough though, I actually met my best friend through SMITE 2 years ago.

-As of right now, this game seems to have a memory leak issue. I haven't looked into it myself personally, but after playing for 3-4 hours, my fps drops and dips constantly, it's easily fixed by a simple restart of them game, I've seen others complain of this issue, but it's nothing too harmful.

All in all, this game is awesome, and let's just say it's good enough to constantly keep bringing me back to it, there's always some fun in this, and overall a very good game to get into if you're into the MOBA genre.

Keep in mind, this is MY personal opinion and review, I know some may disagree with what I've said, but oh well.

reviewText:
It's been out on Steam for less than a day and I've already managed to play it for 60+ hours. I wonder if it's fun... Kappa.

SMITE, made by Hi-Rez Studios, the company behind Tribes: Ascend and upcoming Paladins, is a challenging MOBA to master - you don't click rapidly across the screen as you would playing DOTA 2 or League of Legends as it's more like a third person shooter with abilities instead of bullets (Unless you're playing Apollo; finger pewpew). The most popular game mode is called Arena which is very casual friendly and allows you to play without much game knowledge prior to jumping in (though I highly recommend doing so as not everyone will be nice to you).

The game's modes include:
Arena, 5v5 game mode where the goal is to get kills and lead minions into the opponent's portal located by their base. First to reduce the opponent's ticket total to 0 is the victor.
Joust, 3v3 game mode where the goal is to kill the enemy Titan guarded by a phoenix and a tower. First to defeat the opponent's Titan is the victor.
Conquest, 5v5 game mode with three lanes, the iconic mode of the game and the one the pro scene is based upon - as well as the balancing (which is why some gods might seem overpowered in other game modes). You play one of five roles in a normal game - ADC, the late game sustained damage dealers, Support, the tanky ones that protect the ADCs and help lanes, Mid, the mages that do burst damage, Jungle, the assassin that sets up kills for the team or themselves to win you the game, and Solo, which is usually stopping the opponent from doing things they want to do. ADC and Support will go into the Duo Lane, which is the longest lane (tower distance) next to where the purple buff is, Mid obviously goes to the middle lane, and Solo goes to the shortest lane next to the blue buff, and Jungler roams around the map where needed. This game mode takes the most practice and game knowledge to play well in. The objective in this game mode is also to kill the opponent's Titan, but it has 3 phoenixes and 6 towers protecting it (which with each one still alive, he is tougher to kill).
Assault, 5v5 game mode where everyone is in a single lane with a random god they could pick in a normal game and the objective is once again to kill the Titan protected by 1 phoenix and 2 towers. I recommend getting Salvation in this game mode (and basically never outside of it once you learn mana control) as you can heal your entire team and keep them fighting longer. You cannot return to your base after leaving it in this game mode, so you need to make sure you have everything you need from the store before leaving (or using Nu Wa ulti as that counts as leaving). Another advanced tactic in this mode is to give your death to the tower" which means you let their tower get credit for your death when you need to go get something so they don't get gold for killing you.
Siege
date: 4v4 game mode with two lanes where the objective is yet again to kill the Titan protected by 2 phoenixes and 4 towers. You usually have one physical and one magical god per lane. You may spawn siege minions that are giant beasts that do massive damage to towers
recommended: by getting 100 tickets gained by taking camps and doing well basically. You can also spawn a free one by killing the monster in the middle of the map. You can use a portal at the base to teleport instantly to a siege minion on your team. You cannot buy normal wards in the game mode however
hoursPlayed: so you have to use counterwards called sentry wards
voteText: which means you can only have one ward yourself and they are more expensive. Also since your opponent is also buying only counterwards

reviewText:
Smite has been part of my gaming life for nearly 3 years now, I have seen 44 new gods added, multiple map changes, meta changes and many balance changes. I am going to try and outline why you should try Smite, and why I am still playing it to this day.

You should try Smite because it is a great introduction into the MOBA genre, yet still has an amazingly high skill cap through skill shots and the WASD movement of gods. The controls are very similar to other 3rd person action games which makes it familiar to many gamers, rather than the RTS background of the majority of the other big MOBA's.

Smite also has many different features to allow new players to get into the game without having to search up build orders and prefered skill leveling. Through the auto skill and auto buy functions, new players are given solid builds which will allow them to familiarize themselves with the gods kit without having to worry about the efficiency of the builds. Once new players are confortable with controls, they can turn off auto buy/level and move up to recomended builds, allowing them to counter build to their enemies as the game progresses.

Finally why am I still playing Smite? The balance of the game is close to perfect, with only exeptions being that of new gods which usually take the limelight between balance changes to their kits meaning that there is always a fresh set of top picks for people to play, recent gods such as Ratatoskr was one of the strongest gods in the game until after weekly nerfs has found himself in a nice spot. Current weaker gods such as Zeus is going to have a rekit to bring him to the front of Smite again. This constant change of top gods make the game very replayable.

reviewText:
My First Impressions of Smite
[TLDR at the end]

So I played Smite on PC for the first time last night. I had heard many good things about it from friends, but I had also heard many negative comments from hardcore League or DOTA 2 players. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a real MOBA!‚Äù‚Ä¶‚ÄúIt‚Äôs so easy it‚Äôs boring!‚Äù‚Ä¶‚ÄúGet gud nd play a real game, m8!‚Äù‚Ä¶etc ad nauseum. I wanted to form my own opinions. In the end, I was pleasantly surprised by the game.

Smite is a MOBA at heart, but it plays more like a third-person RPG (i.e. Skyrim). It‚Äôs definitely a more casual game with an extremely short learning curve; players of more hardcore MOBA‚Äôs will be able to pick it up in one night. Gone is the ‚Äúclicking simulator‚Äù movement scheme coupled with QWER ability controls that most MOBA players hold near and dear; in Smite, you control your player with WASD and aim with mouse, which is much more familiar and comfortable for non-MOBA players. However, with this change comes a downside: I found the ability keys cumbersome and hard to reach in a frantic team fight while still trying to move my character. The camera is shifted from the obilgatory overhead view to a third-person over-the-shoulder view, which I found gives the game a more involved, more personal feel. Most of the same mechanics and metagames found in other MOBA‚Äôs can be found in Smite, but with small twists to make them more accessible to casual players.

Smite has three general gameplay modes that I discovered: The typical 5v5, three-lane map with jungles populating the remaining areas; a very fun, hectic 5v5 all-out brawl mode set in an open, circular arena, and ‚ÄúJoust,‚Äù a 3v3 mode similar to League‚Äôs ARAM maps, except with small ‚Äúoff-lanes‚Äù to either side with two jungle camps each.

The god characters are all extremely well researched, well designed, and well-voiced. There is an evident sense that someone put time and effort into researching a god‚Äôs lore to find the perfect design and ailities for him/her.

I held off buying the Steam DLC that unlocks all current and future gods, but after playing the game for about three hours, I came to the conclusion that the game was definitely worth at least $20, and I would be happy to pay Hi-Rez Studios to continue what they‚Äôre doing.

My general impression of the game was simply ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fun!‚Äù The game is easy to pick up, the controls are fairly intuitive, and it looks fantastic. Smite doesn‚Äôt require the finesse and involved strategy of other MOBA‚Äôs, but that is by design. It was a refreshing take on the genre, and I‚Äôm definitely going to play more.

[TLDR: If you‚Äôre looking for anther hardcore MOBA with a steep learning curve and high skill level, you‚Äôll be disappointed. If you‚Äôre new to MOBA‚Äôs or just want a fun game to play, I think you‚Äôll find yourself having a lot fo fun with Smite.]

reviewText: The high skill cap is still there if you want to reach for it. It may not sit on the tallest, Misty Mountainest peak alongside Dota 2, but Smite's skill ceiling balances the approachability of action RPG combat with deep MOBA strategy. The gods are surprisingly diverse in abilities and playstyles, and though balance is always a moving target, almost every god shows up regularly in online play and is capable of deicide in the right hands. MOBAs are vastly complex games that demand skill and study and patience. Recommend this game; really fun and welcoming.

reviewText:
Ignore my steam hours.

This game is really solid and I am sure the new perspective sets it miles apart from any other MOBA clone on the market. So let's get the list down.

PROS:
-Decent graphics
-Regular updates
-Lots of modes to play with (about 6, one of which changes daily and 5 unique maps)
-Unique perspective
-Learning curve with hand holding at the beginning for newcommers
-High variety of gods
-Awesome theme (if Greek mythology doesn't awe you, Norse or Chinese certainly will)
-Optimized for low spec systems
-The whole game provides high sense of personality, wether it is the animations or map design, the game really shows appreciation to the player. i.e Arena mode, the crowd cheers when you do something and there is build up too :D
-Free starting gods with high variety of gods in weekly rotation
-Ability to rent gods
-Fair in-game economy,  no P2W or anything silly (no runes or masteries)
-You will definitely find a playstyle to enjoy, for me its the tank/guardian, but the mage class is also a lot of fun
-Most skills are skillshots, you can avoid most abilities if you are familiar with enemy gods


CONS:
-Some may say that buying gods is not fair, but it was fine for me (DotA 2 player)

Most important part is GAME IS FREE. PLAY IT NOW!



For referal use this when making an account: https://account.hirezstudios.com/smitegame/default.aspx?ok=1&utm_source=RAF&utm_content=14633962&utm_medium=email
I get favor and you gain even more upon leveling up from 10 and onward.

reviewText:
I've played enough Smite BEFORE it was moved to Steam, so here's my review of it:
If you like League of Legends, then you should be right at home with this game(Dota 2, why?). It is a breath of fresh air from generic MOBA games, being a top-down perspective. But here, it's in 3rd person view.

Pros
+ Easy to pick up and play. Gods can easily be mastered in about 2-3 matches. Also it's Free-to-play, NOT pay-to-win.
+ For a game with an ancient mythology theme, the Gods are interesting to play as, and plenty more to come in later updates. EX: Hercules, Loki, Zeus, etc.
+ Great graphics and sound. Nuff said.
+ You are rewarded with points and gems(in-game currency) every time you log in daily. First win of the day is also rewarding.
+ Variety of game modes and 1 random game mode each day. Arena is by far the most fun, being team deathmatch.
+ Best boobs physics for Goddesses. EX: Neith.

Cons
- No voice chat. You have to use Curse or Skype. Or stick to chat or use voice command system in-game.
- Some Gods are INCREDIBLY overpowered if used skillfully. A skilled Loki player will definitely give you PTSD.
- The jump button(yes there is, by pushing Space) is there for lols and has no function in combat, other than bunnyhopping for an achievement.

Overall, it's free to play, it's fun, and is just enjoyable. And by fun, I mean it's so fun that you would stick to this game like glue and unistall League and Dota 2.

reviewText:
Dont be fooled by my hours on steam. I played smite beta for 300-350 hours. Smite is an amazing game.

Pros:
-Not a lot of angry russians
-A large variety of gods
-Amazing concept
-New gods all the time
-Third person adds a whole new level to mobas
-Only skillshots
-Actionpacked

Cons:
-Some slight balancing problems (not to big though)
-Ultimate god pack. What this is is that you pay real money to unlock ALL gods. I think this ruins one of the fun parts of the game which is finally getting that god you been saving up to. Some people love this feature.
-Not all gods should cost the same

Overall this is an excellent game. It brings an entirely new concept to the moba table, and third person mobas is here to stay.

reviewText:
*Hundreds of hours played since BETA, only just decided to use it on Steam*

Gameplay is superb. Always has, and always improves. Most balanced game I've played (That doesn't mean it's 100% balanced, some Gods are broken at times). Developers really put the effort in to make it as enjoyable as possible - many in-game events such as the odyssey and Season ticket. Shop similar to ALL MOBAs, no changes to gameplay. Although they do offer many discounts and bundles, more than I've seen on other games. I enjoy supporting the developers, Hi Rez are one of the most loyal companies imo.

You are as good as your skill level. That's it.

I've got every God mastered at least once. Love them all, many more to come. You have a huge selection of play styles.

Community isn't the worst. I've had my fair share of toxic players, abusing me because I can't save them for being ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. People instalock their favourite God, and then tell you exactly who to play (at times). But I've met a lot of awesome people on this game!

God pack is worth it if you intend on playing this a lot. Seriously, you will LOVE having all Gods available.

reviewText:
This review is for those who are already familiar with MOBAs and have played Dota 2 or League of Legends. I will point out what makes Smite unique compared to those games.

- Third person camera perspective. Unlike the classics, Smite does not feature a strategic top down perspective and puts you right in the action behind your character. This allows for much more precise movements and sneaking up to somebody doesn't necessarily require a cloaking ability.

- (almost) Every ability in the game has to be aimed, including melee and ranged basic attacks! That's right, if you want to play the Ad Carry in Smite, prepare yourself to be completely useless if you can't land your basic attacks. Same goes for everything else: If you can't hit your abilities reliably, you will not succeed, there are precious few abilities in the game that do not need to be aimed. From the other perspective, this mechanic allows you to minimize your damage intake by being a slippery snake and wiggle your way out of tight situations. Many times I was one hit away from death, but moving in circles and triangles and wavy lines and other sorts of unpredictable movements, I survived.

- Playable Characters (Heroes, Champions) in Smite are real Gods from pantheons that were once (and some still are) worshipped. Norse, Roman, Mayan, Hindu, Chinese, Greek. Play as Zeus, Thor, Odin, Loki and many other gods and mythical creatures. HiRez Studios does a (mostly) great job at interpretating these well known deities into detailed playable Characters. And for those Deities you don't know, there is always a lore section for every god, so you even learn something about different cultures while you play. Yay, Knowledge!

- 5 different game modes + one that changes every day. Unlike its competitors, Smite features many different game modes aside from the classical 5vs5 (Here called Conquest). Arena (5vs5, no lanes, Team Deathmatch), Siege (4vs4, Two lanes, small jungle), Joust (3vs3, 1 lane, small jungle), Assault (5vs5, All Random All Mid, 1 lane). The Mode of the Day changes every day and features fun setups (like 5vs5 on the Assault map and everyone get's the same god).

All of these game modes have their own, detailed and well crafted Map. In Conquest Mount Olympus opposes a vulcano, in Arena you fight in a grand Colloseum, in Assault you defend the Halls of Asgard from the forces of Chaos, in Siege you fight for supremecy in the lush Mayan rainforests and in Joust you're a knight for some reason (It will be changed to a Chinese themed map soon).

In addition to that, Smite features one of the best deals in a Free to Play game: The God Pack. The God Pack costs 30$ and contains every god currently in the game. Owners of the God Pack also receive the newest God as soon as they're released. FOREVER. That means, the more Gods join the battle of Smite, the more value you get for your 30$. You do the math.

Why should you play Smite over League or Dota? If you love mythology and you like the concept of MOBAs, but never liked the top down perspective and ferocious clicking of the traditional ones, Smite will be the game for you. It's highly skill-based with a very high skill ceiling and many new challenges and skills to master that traditional MOBAs do not have. I played League of Legends for 4 years, but after I got Athritis (This is a joke) from playing ADC and kiting for too long, I gave up. For me, Smite is so much more comfortable to play and the fact that I can escape my death and make great plays simply by evading and aiming my abilities carefully really drives me forward in a way traditional MOBAs never did.

I will not end this review without pointing out things that bug me about Smite, I am not delusional:

Many Skins in Smite are locked behind Chests, which you have to buy with real money currency and by opening them, you only have a certain chance to get the skin you want. It can be infuriating when a cool new Skin for your favourite God is announced, only to later find out it's in a Chest with 56 other items. HiRez abuses this a bit too much. Though we have the God Pack, so that balances it out.

EU Servers can be very unreliable.

Quality Control at HiRez is either non-existent or very bad. Some new Gods release in a pitiful state, either balance or design-wise. They have horrid animations, amateur-like voice acting and are either drastically underpowered or overpowered. Some God Designs are also very questionable. Sometimes they have ability kits that have nothing to do with their Lore, or in general are designed in such a way that they make no sense. Did you know the Spartans put the statues of Ares, the God of War, in chains to restrain him? Yeah, that's cool, but only a small footnote in his lore. Well, what HiRez did was base his whole ingame design on that little fact. He shoots chains and fire and runs around in plate armor with broadsword and shield. The shield has a demonic visage on it, where the fire comes out. Does that sound like the Greek God of War to you? Not to me.

But these things are minor and ultimately do not take away much from my experience. I've been playing this game for more than a year, and only looking forward.

It's free in the end, so why not try it out and look for yourself?

reviewText:
Including the time spent on steam, I've spent around 1022 hours on this game. Started around early 2013, I believe...

I could never really get into MOBAs but it was pretty easy to get into this one after finding a god I loved to play, and played Fenrir for a long while. It's been nice to finally step foot into a genre, even though it's a rather oversaturated one. Smite brings a fresher take on it, for me. There are very few gods I dislike playing, and most modes are pretty fun even though some gods can be utterly broken and OP in them (Gods are balanced around conquest though, so you gotta cope.)

My only big issue with this game is how utterly and stupidly powerful most god releases are. I believe the first god that got released when I started was Hun Batz or Chronos, so I can't claim to have been around for release Guan Yu (though I was around when he was still a guardian, and damn he still hurt) but living through things like Nemesis release, Geb release, AMC's release, were all plain and utter nightmares. This trend still continues with Bellona's release, or god forbid Sol taking towers a minute into the start of games.


Overall I recommend it because it's a great time sink, but I dodge (casual) conquest until new gods get nerfed because they tend to make your life pure misery.

reviewText: I have played this game for many years and seen many changes. I've played countless hours, far more than steam knows. I am a huge fan of the game and like HiRez as a company - a one off payment gets all gods, present and future, pretty good deal. The game itself is great, as a previous fan of Lol and Dota, I have found Smite much more enjoyable and more intense. The community is varied, for a long time it was excellent but lately it has become more toxic, still less toxic than i remember Lol being - the reason i stopped playing Lol. Smite is very rewarding to land abilities and get kills through skill, my one dislike is the matchmaking. On more than one occasion I have been teamed up with famous names in smite. I'm not a good smite player, it's not fun getting stomped by players far better than yourself. Other than that, an excellent game and I look forward to seeing how massive it becomes.

reviewText: I have spent nearly 700 hours in-game with Smite. That's not time in menus, not me leaving the game on overnight. That's in-game, playing and being active. Smite is an outstanding MOBA with so many unique features and mechanics that it's difficult to call it a MOBA. This isn't League of Legends, Heroes of the Storm, or DoTA. This is SMITE. 3rd person, over-the-shoulder camera angles, Gods based off of various mythologies, various modes to suit any playstyle, and some of the best damn graphics a free-to-play game has to offer. Not to mention they have one of the best business models of any MOBA (next to DoTA with their sheer weight of money). $30 and you own EVERY god in the game. Present and Future Gods. Yep. Everything is simply fashion and cosmetic. Not a bad deal. Also, if you unlock gods before purchasing the Ultimate God Pack using the in-game currency, you get all of that back. So what are you waiting for? Download this and start slaying Gods.

reviewText: Smite is one of those games that you could spend days, weeks or even years and you would never get bored. Smite also offer special MOTD (Match of the Day) with mild to intensive shenanigans and 5 other modes that brings something different to the table. The art style of this game is absolutely great (well, depends if you have a potato, this goes for the graphics also) and brings an almost accurate depiction of the gods and goddesses. The game also hosts or has special weekends where you can earn bonus gems and favours (in-game currency), which can be one of the worst weeks of smite. To top it all off, the game itself isn't too bad and can be heaps of fun (have friends play with you). And beware of the odyssey and treasure chests, unless you want to take your chances (but both of them are a great addition to smite) because your wallets might disappear.\n\n

reviewText:
Third person view behind the character with direct controls instead of mouse clicking for movement is a nice change from other MOBA's. The view and Controls are similar to Super Monday Night Combat which I loved.
Has five basic classes with Gardian, Hunter, Assasin, Mage, Warrior. Each has enough variation within to not get bored.

Sometimes can be frustrating other times you can feel godlike somewhat depending on your teamates. Thats what makes it fun everygame is different and you keep coming back to catch the games your team is all in sync.
I'm more casual and stick to Assault mode, Arena, and the newer clash modes.

Would recommend can easily lose a whole day playing without realizing the time has gone by.

reviewText:
SMITE is good but I can't get into it. The only other MOBA I play is HoTs and I play a level 20 healer main there. There is no standalone healers in this game so I really have no choice but to play something I'm not comfortable with.

Pros and cons to me personally.

Pros:

- Lots of gods

- Active dev team

- Various game modes (arena being my favourite)

- Reasonably balanced for the amount of gods.

- Some funny gods and voice lines.

Cons:

- Not fun to learn when you keep getting 2 shot by other players. Puts you off the game as theres no way to learn what mistake you made you just leave spawn and boom, dead and yes I am following guides and builds.

- Overpriced store. The micro transactions are just too expensive. 400 gems costs more than 2 TF2 keys and that is the price of 1 unbox. For somebody that has unboxed around 400 crates on TF2 I say its overpriced. Not to mention the fact skins you want are thrown in 1/100 crates so you never get what you want and there is no trading feature to trade for what you want, major let down for someone like me that is not afraid to spend for customization. TF2 is evident in my spending. (around $3000 spent)

- No standalone healer support :(

so I'm just gonna keep chipping away at this game with my friends and see if I ever can find that ideal god. I just wish with the new Japanese pantheon they would add the games first standalone healer, maybe Uzume. But the way the games meta is, it seems there will be no place for us healer mains to truely get into SMITE.

either way I recommend.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Smite is a Free to Play Third Person Action PVP game in a MOBA format.
Have played 37 hours before Smite released on Steam, i only play casually on CO-OP maps against AI, but it is fun enough against bots for me.

It has bonus cash on first PVP match of the day and login reward.
Has a tutorial matches on all maps and can play CO-OP against AI on all maps.
Has tutorial videos on the gods, match videos.

Has six 5 vs 5 PVP maps of various sizes and has ranked matches.   Set up as an E-Sport league game.
The player avatars look great, great graphics, gameplay and action.  You can buy skins for your avatars with real money.  For 30 dollars, you can buy All the current and future gods.

Has Steam Achievements, but they look like you can only do them if you play pvp matches.

Give it a try, it is free and different from other MOBAs.
Great game, if you like competative PVP e-sports.

reviewText: I have spent nearly 700 hours in-game with Smite. That's not time in menus, not me leaving the game on overnight. That's in-game, playing and being active. Smite is an outstanding MOBA with so many unique features and mechanics that it's difficult to call it a MOBA. This isn't League of Legends, Heroes of the Storm, or DoTA. This is SMITE. 3rd person, over-the-shoulder camera angles, Gods based off of various mythologies, various modes to suit any playstyle, and some of the best damn graphics a free-to-play game has to offer. Not to mention they have one of the best business models of any MOBA (next to DoTA with their sheer weight of money). $30 and you own EVERY god in the game. Present and Future Gods. Yep. Everything is simply fashion and cosmetic. Not a bad deal. Also, if you unlock gods before purchasing the Ultimate God Pack using the in-game currency, you get all of that back. So what are you waiting for? Download this and start slaying Gods.

reviewText: Smite is an awesome and fast-paced twist on a genre popularized by DOTA and League of Legends.  I myself tried but never enjoyed the latter two mostly due to the control scheme and method by which the player interacts with the game.  I always felt as if I should've been playing an RTS, not a game that requires so much precision and reflex.  Some consider Smite's design to be the way MOBA's were meant to be played, and claim that the traditional DOTA style was a result of technical limitations; successors simply followed that format.  I can't say I disagree.  Smite is very intuitive to anyone who has played first or third-person shooters on the PC, or games like World of Warcraft.  I find it so much easier and more engaging to move with WASD and aim with a mouse.  It makes the game easier to pick up without lowering the skill ceiling, and gives players a sense of satisfaction when they have good aim or avoid the aim of their opponents.  After over three years of playing Smite, I can say with certainty that the game has only gotten better, and I enjoy it now more than I ever have.

reviewText:
Coming from a Beta Player 2013 - Still today.
Smite isn't your typical MOBA. As you've most likely found out, it's played from a Third-Person angle instead of the usual Top-Down perspective most MOBA's have. But there's a lot more than that that sets this one apart from the others.
All playable characters in the game are based off of Gods from many different pantheons and cultures, and the list grows larger and larger about every 1-2 months. And in this game, I actually feel like the Gods have character and personality as oppose to other MOBA's or games in general. Hi-Rez studios keeps this game up-to-date with its usual weekly updates, and have in-depth notes and videos they post on social medias.
But enough about that, the maps and gamemodes I feel are well thought out, but at the same time very simple. Standard 3v3 Joust, 5v5 Deathmatch, etc. (You can also make custom matches with any rules you want and can invite friends to parties and clans.) The community I feel is fine, but sometimes you'll probably run into that hardcore pro guy that stops to type about every mistake you make but usually it's all good. Who knows you (You as in I,) may even need that constructive criticism.
But trust me here, I barely scratched the surface of what this game is like. You'd really have to play it for yourself.
I definitely recommend you trying this out. New or experienced with MOBA's, you'll surely have a great time with this one, especially with friends.

reviewText:
Smite is a Free to Play Third Person Action PVP game in a MOBA format.
Have played 37 hours before Smite released on Steam, i only play casually on CO-OP maps against AI, but it is fun enough against bots for me.

It has bonus cash on first PVP match of the day and login reward.
Has a tutorial matches on all maps and can play CO-OP against AI on all maps.
Has tutorial videos on the gods, match videos.

Has six 5 vs 5 PVP maps of various sizes and has ranked matches.   Set up as an E-Sport league game.
The player avatars look great, great graphics, gameplay and action.  You can buy skins for your avatars with real money.  For 30 dollars, you can buy All the current and future gods.

Has Steam Achievements, but they look like you can only do them if you play pvp matches.

Give it a try, it is free and different from other MOBAs.
Great game, if you like competative PVP e-sports.

reviewText: I usually play more MMORPGs, FPS or RTS games. That said i personally have better map awareness with map in the top right side VS the bottom of screen like all other MOBAs (ex LoL). The auto ability lvl feature is helpfull but not necessary. When learning a new champ/god it helps to put your abilities levels in order prior to a match & they stay there till you either uncheck the auto ability lvling just b4 a match, change them or get rid of them. Unlike other MOBAs Smite keeps ur pots seperate from your items so you can get that extra item or 2 if you were ever the type to keep them (dont know why but there are ppl like that out there). Also from what I've seen in other MOBAs Smite has more varity in match types (7 types atm). Just like any other MOBA its all about the Objectives." If your not a team player or care more about your kill count then this is not the game for you. Only negative ive seen in playing this game are the few times when fellow team mates or the other team completely left their more squishy team mates alone an vunerable from the start.\n\nStill loving it & still cant beat the community."

reviewText:
Disclaimer: I have played this game alot before the steam release, I have a lot more playtime than displayed.

Smite is hard to learn and hard to master. Mastering this game requires mechanical skill, great awareness, patience, strategizing, team play ability, communicative abilities, accumulating a broad amount of game knowledge, memorizing timings on the spot, a competetive mindset...

I am not going to lie. It is not the easiest game to get into and I myself had to take breaks from it. What really kept me hooked was having people to play it with to grind it out. I definetly do recommend playing this game with friends or eagerly searching for people to play with. It is a team game afterall and it makes it alot more fun.

That being said once you get into it is really fun. All the of the challenging aspects of this game aren't only intimidating but they are a also calling you out for challenge some might be eager to pursue and to accomplish. (Hard game? Challenge accepted)
It is one of my favourite pvp games. You win a pvp game by doing better then your opponent. And in this game there are a dozen of things you can do better in than your opponent to win the game.
There is no lost game. You might always outplay/outsmart your opponent, something other mobas lack I find.

To cut to the point. Should you play this game?
Are you open for a challenging cooperative pvp game that requires you to reach perfection in an intimidating amount of aspects to do well in?
Are you ready to invest a lot of time into a game to learn it from scratch and optimize your mechanical skill?
Are you an open minded person, that thrives using communication to reach the full potential of not only yourself but of your entire team?
Then I do recommend you check out smite.

If you are impatient though, faint-hearted, and easily get stressed out or if you just want something casual to burn time on, then unfortunately I can't recommend this game to you.

If you decide you are going to play Smite, here are some tips:
-Find people to play with! I can't stress enough how much that will improve the experience for you.
-Start using a mic & curse voice" as soon as possible. (btw curse voice has great integration with smite)
-Do analyze your mistakes. As a beginner you are doing EVERYTHING wrong. Therefore looking for mistakes is very rewarding. There will be many to find.
-Be nice to people. Mute people that aren't nice.
-If you have anger management issues use push to talk. It is a part of the being nice thing
-Watch Smite streams and youtube channels of esport athletes."

reviewText:
Sometimes employees will come stomp you: http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/419188332385814999/FCBD9BD934A8D29F6A3BFC5C46BB595B70E5E51E/

I've played this game for 2 years now. It's like League of Legends meets World of Warcraft. The DotA style arena with the 3rd person view point is exactly what I needed after playing League of Legends and finding the click to move style needlessly annoying.

Game modesArena: 5v5 in a round arena, 2 sets of jungle buffs and minions running towards the opponents portals for points, kills = 5 points. 500 point start value. Average gamne time 10-15 minutes.

Conquest: Typical 5v5 - 3 lanes with 2 towers and a phoenix each, and jungles. You have the Gold Fury and Fire Giant for money boosts and end game buff respectively. I don't play this much, but it's likely the most popular, with a League version availible as well.

Joust: 3v3 1 Lane 1 tower & 1 phoenix, 2 sets of jungles. There is a 1v1 League for this map.

Assault: 5v5 1 Lane 2 towers & 1 phoenix, no Jungle. Random picks with trading and rerolls. Can only buy when dead or at the start.

Match of the Day: Variety fun that isn't counted in the statistics.

Siege:  2 lanes with a jungle, Spawning super minions to assist with push.

reviewText:
Intro! 	Hello! Some know me as Hell, some as Claptrap, but most know me through school, but this review is for all of you!
I've been playing smite since Cupid release (about 2 and a half years ago). However, and unfortunate event happened and my account was stolen, so I made the account that I play on to this day. The company backing this game at that time refunded me my gems and limited skins, as well as deleting my old account.

General Info!    	Smite is a MOBA that pits you as one of many gods against other gods in modes with objectives such as (towers, pheonixes, titans, etc.) Also, all of the characters in game, are based on REAL MYTHOLOGY, such as the norse, egyptians, romans, greeks, and mayans. Smite is also third-person, which is what makes MOBA players from all over gather and play this mix of third-person and MOBA. My only tip for you is that this game will make you love it, and it'll also make you want to destroy it. No matter what, even when you tell yourself you're bad, stick with it. This game, unlike most others gets better over time.

Recommendations!  	GOD PACK <3
Its a great deal, although I'd at least wait until you're level 30 and are positive that you'll completely want it. It is a worthy investment at any price. You get all the gods that are out, and those that'll come out, all for 30$ I got it when there were only around 25 gods I think? I've never looked back.

I recommend downloading Curse Voice to chat with friends, and to meet new people! I'd also recommmend to start out in arena and learn the basics of each god. Theres also this neat feature inside the game called VGS, its basically call outs that you'd make in chat rooms such as: [VVGH] Hi! [VSAA] I'll attack! and so forth. My personal favorite god is Hel (look at my name), she is the goddess of the underworld! Each character, like other games has jokes, and taunts. One of her jokes" includes:
(light side) "I know! We should make cookies!"
(dark side) "COOKIES!? WHAT THE **** IS WRONG WITH YOU!?

Now of course
date: not every god talks about making cookies and beating the living "hell" out of each other. But please. without further ado

reviewText: SMITE is way better than LoL. (No offense to LoL community.) I think this game is just a little more fun for me than LoL anyways. If you are new then I would say play Arena or Joust. It's a great game mainly to play with friends who you know won't let you down and die everytime they run out into the battlefield. Good luck and I hope this review helps anyone who wants to play this game.

reviewText: Gotta say. For a MOBA, this game is quite nice. Could never really get into MOBA's until I played this. Don't have much time logged in on this version yet but have put at least 9 days of playtime into the Xbox One version. It's a very addicting game and has well written lore on the different Gods/Characters from the many different Pantheons. Has very simple controls and can be played with various gamepads/controllers that make them even simpler. Also, the in-game tutorials are very detailed and helpful for those who are new to the game. Another thing I like about this game is that, although you can use microtransactions to purchase characters/skins/VP/etc. You can also still earn the two different types of in-game currency simply by playing the game. Allowing you to still purchase most of the forementioned things above. All in all it's a very fun and addictive game to play alone or with friends.

reviewText:
Smite is a Third-Person view moba, this differs it from the other moba's and makes it stand out. Smite is all about skill shots and if you can't aim this game isnt for you.

You know a game is great when you just do not stop playing it, even when you are tired of the game you still come back. This is the longest i've ever played a game in one go. I've played games like battlefield heroes for multiple years but that was when playing for limited amounts of time, lets say 6 months and then stop for another 6-8 months. This isn't the case for Smite. I've been playing this game non stop without long stops for 1+ year. The only time i stopped was when H1Z1, Ark survival and Fallout 4 came out. If you find some friends and bellends to play with, this is a great game. The matches are fun and can be either quick or really long. When you make a team with your friends and get to play a certain role, you have the chance to get better at that role and do more random ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• with it. This game keeps you going and is fun to play when you have the time for it. Also this game contains Kukulkan.

Pros:
Different matches each time you play
Keeps you going
Regular patches, every 2 weeks on tuesday/wednesday
Plenty of gods
Pro scene is great
Alot of players
6 modes, 2 league modes and a match of the day
Free gems
Plenty of double xp, worshippers and favor weekends
Skins for days
Announcer packs, Borders, Ward skins, Icons, Pedestals, Emotes and Voice Packs. Everything in this game is customizable exept for your abilities, the map and the items.
Semi-Good community
Almost everyone speaks english
3rd Person view
Beginner friendly
Everything
Kukulkan
Kukulkan
Kukulkan

Cons:
Semi-Long queues
Serqet
Addicting at first
When there is a patch servers will be down for hours guaranteed
Some nerfs and buffs that aren't needed
Ne Zha Remodel
Tryharders
God balance can be bad

Overall this game is a great game is and definitly worth your time.
I myself have 550 hours ingame atm, this isn't alot but i've been playing other games aswell in the meantime.
The gods have a great backstory and there are alot of gods to choose from. From the mighty zeus till the humble kukulkan.

Just give this game a go and see if you enjoy it.

I rate this game a solid 5/7 (Please get this reference, if not search Brendan Sullivan vs Robert Graves in google)

Ps: Kukulkan

Pps: Kukulkan is a joke, he is one of the worst gods, no good escape, if you are close to him he can't do much and will most certainly die without panic ulting
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Don't like or suck terribly at League of Legends or Dota 2? Then SMITE might be something for you. The difficulty curve is a lot smaller than in League or Dota 2 which makes the game more fun to play on the get go. The 3rd person camera angle makes the game feel much more fun and action oriented and you actually have to learn to aim to hit your abilities and attacks. Each god have a fun and unique personality that makes them stand out from the crowd and to top that every god is beautifuly modeled and greatly voice acted with voice packs you can buy in game so the voice commands are said by the god you are playing and bought it for. Skins are here too with a basic recolor that costs regular in game currency and different modeled ones for premium currency which you can buy for real money or earn on day six and seven as your daily log in reward. The game also features right now six different game modes so you will never be bored and every one will give you a win of the day bonus so you can earn in game basic currency faster, your standard three lanes with jungle game mode is present too of course. The graphics look good and the options menu is very extensive so you can modify the game to perform or look as good as possible on your PC. The community is far from as toxic as League of Legends and barely has any Russians in it like in Dota 2 so team work is almost always guaranteed. And the business model here is very generous compared to League. Everything is pretty much the same when it comes to premium currency and the cost for heroes but for 29.99$ or 23.99‚Ç¨ you can buy the Ultimate God Pack which gives you every single god in the game, every future god and a refund on all basic in game currency you have spent on any gods previously so you can spend all that on emotes or the basic recolors. Now that is a generous deal if you ask me. The only negative thing I can think of is that there is some balancing issues where some gods are too OP and some are completely worthless but thank god Hi-Rez is working to fix that. The god which was concidered by the community to be the worst god in the game just got a massive buff so he's on par with every other god and too OP gods have been nerfed in the past as well.

tl;dr
Positive:
+3rd person camera angle and the aiming required gives the game more action
+Easier difficulty curve
+Noob friendly
+Great gods with unique personalities
+A lot of cool skins and voice packs
+Earn premium currency in game!
+Friendly and great developers
+Great community (Compared to League and Dota 2)
+Extremely fair business model

Negative:
-Some balancing issues
-Too addicting
-Will leave you sleepless for days
-No Jesus DLC yet

reviewText:
I've been playing smite for the last 2 years and im currently Masters,Smite is alot of fun to play with friends but when your solo q'ing there's not many good players

Pros:
Very fun/addictive game.
Daily logins give you gems so you can buy stuff
Patches every 2 weeks or so(regular content updates)
Alot of different gamemodes to play
You can buy the god pack for about ¬£20 something like that, its SUCH a good deal because you unlock all gods & all future gods too
The esports scene is HUGE right now, theres not many good teams apart from the spl teams so you definetly all have a shot at it
Every year they release a thing called '' The Odyssey'' where you can purchase several items and it contributes to the esports prize pool making it bigger
Hirez listen's to the community on what they think is ''op'' and what needs adjustment and they fix it quickly, although they dont listen to the pros they only listen to the general smite community

Cons:
Matchmaking at a higher level is pretty much garbage
The way ranked works, the tp system AND matchmaker are broken
The servers for EU are pretty trash
For a game that has over 10 million players, there's WAY too many bugs still in the game
Very difficult for newbies to learn e.g builds, what abilites to max first, where to start in conquest
Boosters and Ward skins are stupid,they dont give you any benefits apart from 2 extra worshippers per game and a fancy looking ward (who cares?)its basically a way to take money

Overall I think smite is a super fun to play game but i've played around 5000 games + and it starts to get boring, although you should definetly give it a shot :)

reviewText:
I love this game.

I recently bought the Ultimate God Pack DLC, so I unlock all current & future gods automatically. It makes the game a lot more enjoyable, simply because you don't ever have to worry about unlocking gods again! Each god is worth trying because of all of their unique combat moves/abilities.
If you find you like the game I highely recommend getting the ultimate god pack, it's 20 bucks, and you're set for life pretty much. Unless you're a skin ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• like myself.. then you have other issues to worry about. Overall tho, this game is my favorite MOBA hands down. The camera angles are what take this game to the next level. And it's FREE, you don't NEED to spend a dime to have fun with this game, trust me.

9.5/10

reviewText:
Smite is a very unique MOBA(Multiplayer Online Battle Arena)in the sense that you are in the 3rd person perspective instead of the traditional top down perspective. I think this makes smite a easier MOBA for people that haven't played any MOBAs before.
The controls are also very different from other MOBAs. In Smite you control your god with the WASD keys. This is another reason that Smite is better for newer MOBA fans.
The overall gameplay is very good for Smite. The teams are usually ballanced and it is not difficult to make friends with people in game. Most of the community is really nice. There probably would be a learning curve if the community wasn't so helpful. HiRez studios reallu does listen to the the community very well. There are a varity of skins that are community sugestions.
In conclusion, Smite is a very different type of MOBA. While others have tried and failed this, Smite succeded. The community is very good and I sugest this too you whether you are just getting into MOBAs or have been with them from the start.

reviewText:
Smite is one pretty special game for me... I once decided to try League of Legends and well... It didn't work out it was boring and I really didn't wanted to click more because I felt it missed some action. And then I decided to try out DOTA 2 but it was the same boring gameplay and it was just not quite fun for me.

Then.
A.
Miracle.
Happened.

I decided to try out this brand new MOBA called 'Smite' which wasn't exactly brand new because it was still on beta and hell it was a lot of fun.

The game occurs in this third person view and makes most of the skill into shooting skillshots at the right times, and that really increasses the amount of action you get from the game which I feel like it makes the game fun to play, This camera also changes a lot of the gameplay stuff like hiding is now different and jukes are pretty interesting...

The game isn't perfect because it still a bit unbalanced but at least it's fun to play and I think thats what matters, Community is pretty good, not perfect but better than the Leagues one and this is probably the first game in which I see russians are nice lmao.

8.6/10
