reviewText:
I've tried LoL, DOTA and a few other MOBA's, but I just couldn't get into the isometric click-fest. After having played the beta I gave SMITE another shot when it launched 1,5 years ago and I never looked back. More than a 1000 hrs later I'm still playing every single day.

It will take you some time and practice to get used to it all, but It's more accessible compared to other MOBA's due to it having less items and being able to turn on auto-buy/level. Positioning is a big part of being successful as well as aiming, timing, communication and synergy making it hard to master.

The game is based on mythology from 7 different pantheons and the 69 gods (at the time of writing) all have lore related directed taunts, which adds a lot of humour to the mix. 5 different classes, 8 game-modes on 5 different maps offer something to enjoy for everyone.

Regular updates and patches keep the game fresh. With plenty of free gems" events and sales you won't need to spend tonnes of cash on cosmetics if you don't want to. (I have accumulated 1000s of gems and free stuff in my playtime)

Being the 3rd Biggest MOBA with 2nd largest tournament prizepools in e-sports history I think I can safely say Hi-Rez finally hit the right spot with this game.

The only negative things I can think of are that on a rare occasion the servers lag and sometimes matchmaking can be a bit wonky
date: which isn't too big of a deal if you don't play ranked leagues. As with any online game you get a few toxic players every now and then
recommended: but they can easily be muted or ignored and more often than not you will find nice and reasonable folk in your matches.\n\nFurthermore I can reccommend playing/queueing with friends. Once you get used to the 3rd person and aiming
hoursPlayed: turn off auto-buy/level and use sites like Tiermonster.com for item builds. The bots in co-op game-modes are horribly bad
voteText:

reviewText: I know my steam play time is low but I've been playing this game for a solid amount of time before this released here and I love it so much. This is from someone who hated MOBAs and everything about them but I was a bit curious and thought that Smite seemed like a good entry point and since then this has been the only game I consistently play. The gods are all so cool and the mythology adds a fun layer with the characters plus actually seeing the skins you have on your god is pretty great. The motd is a fun addition because it spices things up a little if you don't want to play a traditional game mode, which Smite has a solid amount of. The daily log in bonus is great because I haven't spent a penny on this game and I have a bunch of gods and skins and ward skins and icons. If you're someone who doesn't like MOBAs I would suggest you give this one a try because it might just click for you. That all being said, it seems the steam version might be a bit iffy right now so you may want to wait and download it from Hi Rez, either way, I hope you play this game.

reviewText:
The MOBA of the future.

It combines all of the high intensity game play of an RTS with the lane pushing, character depth and objective based play of its other MOBA brethren and rounded out with an almost fully skill shot based kit out of all gods COMPLETE with the skills required for shooters in the form of the auto attacks!

If you want to get away from the shonky balancing of League of Legends, looking for a game that requires a different play style than Counter Strike and don't want to learn the intense intricacies of DOTA? Well Smite fills all of those niches AND it even plays it out in the universe of all gods in a range of mythologies!

See you on the battlefield player!

reviewText:
I've tried LoL, DOTA and a few other MOBA's, but I just couldn't get into the isometric click-fest. After having played the beta I gave SMITE another shot when it launched 1,5 years ago and I never looked back. More than a 1000 hrs later I'm still playing every single day.

It will take you some time and practice to get used to it all, but It's more accessible compared to other MOBA's due to it having less items and being able to turn on auto-buy/level. Positioning is a big part of being successful as well as aiming, timing, communication and synergy making it hard to master.

The game is based on mythology from 7 different pantheons and the 69 gods (at the time of writing) all have lore related directed taunts, which adds a lot of humour to the mix. 5 different classes, 8 game-modes on 5 different maps offer something to enjoy for everyone.

Regular updates and patches keep the game fresh. With plenty of free gems" events and sales you won't need to spend tonnes of cash on cosmetics if you don't want to. (I have accumulated 1000s of gems and free stuff in my playtime)

Being the 3rd Biggest MOBA with 2nd largest tournament prizepools in e-sports history I think I can safely say Hi-Rez finally hit the right spot with this game.

The only negative things I can think of are that on a rare occasion the servers lag and sometimes matchmaking can be a bit wonky
date: which isn't too big of a deal if you don't play ranked leagues. As with any online game you get a few toxic players every now and then
recommended: but they can easily be muted or ignored and more often than not you will find nice and reasonable folk in your matches.\n\nFurthermore I can reccommend playing/queueing with friends. Once you get used to the 3rd person and aiming
hoursPlayed: turn off auto-buy/level and use sites like Tiermonster.com for item builds. The bots in co-op game-modes are horribly bad
voteText:
get into PvP as soon as possible. Read some guides and watch streams to improve your game. If you enjoy the game get "the ultimate god pack" (unlocks all gods+future gods) it's the best deal in moba games.

[VVGL] Good Luck
[VVGF] Have fun!

9/10 would kappa again."

reviewText:
OMG MY LIFE IS COMPLETE NOW
I've been waiting for Smite to be released on Steam for so long and I really hope this game becomes popular. It brings a whole new unique perspective into the world of MOBA and this game mostly relies on skillshots (except for Neith's ult) which I find fascinating. The gods/goddesses in this game are really detailed and fun to use. I prefer the 3rd person cam instead of the bird's eye view - it makes it harder to see what's behind me. They have a plethora of voice commands (it may be hard at first but after some time it'd be drilled into the back of your head) making it easy to communicate and purchasable voice packs to go along with it. There are also many outside references (ex: Khepri's victory dance with the cyclops aka Jake dancing with the beetle from Adventure Time) and taunts to specific gods. The community is farrrrrr better than LoL and the game mechanics are fairly simple. Not to mention, they have many events where they give out free gems!

(If I hear another fanboy saying that Smite ripped from LoL I will literally go insane)

reviewText:
Good Stuff
I've been playing this game on and off since Beta. I never got really into it since I was super into League of Legends.
But since i've put my League days behind me I've picked this game up again.

I can honestly say that SMITE is a much more enjoyable experience than other MOBAs out there. The community doesn't make me want to shoot myself, the gameplay is interesting with it's third person view, and the game is simple enough for anyone to pick up. I've been playing SMITE casually with some friends and it's been an all around fun time for all of us. There was not a single person telling us to Die and get cancer".

My only real gripes with the game are for the business model. It's both fantastic and a little bit wonky. In SMITE you can buy the Ultimate God Pack
date: which gives you every God and every God that will ever come out

reviewText: I started playing Smite about a year ago, and I was hooked instantly. The concept of MOBAs had always intrigued me, but I struggled to enjoy the ones I tried because of the mouse movement controls and isometric viewpoint, among other reasons. When I heard Smite was a 3rd-person, WASD-controlled MOBA with an emphasis on skillshots, I had to try it, and I'm glad I did. The game is a fantastic team-oriented experience with a great depth of stragegy/gameplay/skill. The character design and implementation is amazing, the lore of mythological gods battling is a blast, and the variety of abilities, skills, gamemodes, events, etc. has kept me coming back for more ever since I started. Try it - you won't be disappointed!

reviewText: I have never really written a review for any game on steam, but this game breaks that mold, in fact it breaks lots of molds in the MOBA genre in all. Its a MOBA game that uses a third person camera at all times, while this may seem like a quirky gimmic that makes the game uninteresting in a few moments of gameplay it does not. It always keeps my attention and I waste hours playing this game without even realising it and thats the thing. Whenever I try to play any other MOBA game (Dota 2/League of Legends) I get bored quickly because I feel like the action just isnt there. This game on the contrary is always filled with excitment and im always on my toes when I play this game. All of the Basic attacks are whats called skill shots" meaning you have to aim in order to kill anyone in this game. Unlike other MOBA games you do not click on the ground to move
date: instead you move with the WASD keys and you have to option to re bind them to something else. Currently the game has about 69 Gods to play as from different pantheons. Gods are essentially your character that you can choose to play as or a "Champion" if you will and they all look and sound Great! Hell the entire game looks amazing even when everything was turned down on low! The game modes vary from conquest (5V5) to Joust (3V3) and if that isnt enough you have a MOTD or a "mode of the day" which should add a little something to your life if you ever get bored of Classic 5V5. A MOTD is a random mode with the rules changed whether it be Extra money or all one character or a mode where everyone is already to the max level. In the end I could keep going about how amazing this game is ( I have played this for like a gazillion hours before it even came to steam) Or I could just end on saying
recommended: if you want to try a MOBA game thats a little diffrent but still fun Smite is your game!"

reviewText:
- Fast paced MOBA in the third person perspective. Very unique and much fun at once. Such action.
- The characters are Gods from 7 different Pantheons and all are almost unique compared to others individually.
- A very good F2P price model. A pack offers you all currently released and future gods for a set price and you can spend your ingame money on other stuff. Mostly cosmetics. No pay to win in this game.
- Hi-Rez (Devs behind the game) are very kind and generous to it's players. Lots of free rewards and stuff.
- Constantly beeing patch with new content. No end in sight just yet.
- Meta is constantly changing, a meta never last really long.
- eSport scene is thriving and watching pro players playing the game on high ranked play is a joy.

There's not much complain about, other than:

- Community can be toxic sometimes. Mute and ignore if you can. This problem exist in every MOBA however.
- Game has tad bit of optimization problems with AMD cards from what I can tell. Still, runs really well on older rigs.

Love this game. I've been playing since Beta, took a break however (was playing League of Legends competetive at the time) and came 4 months ago back to it. I would recommend it to everyone who enjoys MOBA's with a very unique aspect. 9/10

reviewText:
I have been playing Smite since the release of closed BETA. I can honestly say it is my favorite competitive game I have ever played. I used to play LoL but I fell out of love and started looking for something else. I tried DOTA but it never spoke to me. Smite speaks to me as a guy who plays action games like shooters and fighting games.

- Controls feel great and the perspective feels natural. New players might feel awkward moving due to the movement penalty for strafing and backpedaling but you quickly get used to it and learn why it is there. Almost every attack is a skillshot that you have to aim including the basic attacks. This means that crazy plays and exciting moments are much more common in Smite.
- The gods have amazing designs and have expressive personalities. Ratatoskr is adorable. Sun Wukong is awesome. Nu Wa is beautiful. Hel is funny. You get the idea. Being able to play one of your favorite gods is a big draw.
- The game is fast paced and with lots of action. There is always someone to fight and the main Conquest map encourages more fighting and less farming than other MOBAs.
- Game length can vary. They average about 25 minutes but low level games can drag on on to 50 minutes. Games where everyone on one team is doing well can end in 10 minutes.
- The game features lots of other game modes. Arena for quick TDM type play. Siege for a simpler version of the main mode. Assault for all random characters down a single lane. 3v3 and 1v1 joust. Finally a Mode of the Day for a new crazy game mode every day. 80% CDR with only Zeus? Why not?
- Frequent updates (2 every month) keep the game fresh and balanced. The balance is well done and almost every god is viable. New players might get frustrated against gods like Anubis and Ares but you will learn how to fight them (and how to buy actives).
- The game has tutorials and practice modes with simple AI so you can get used to the controls and getting used to the mechanics. If you don't want to worry about items or leveling your skills, you can set the game to auto level them for you. You can even change what the game buys and levels for you before a match and of course turn it off altogether. This allows the game to be much easier to learn than most other MOBAs.

Overall if you prefer your games fast paced or don't like traditional MOBAs, give this one a shot. You don't have to play the main MOBA mode and you can stick to Arena or any of the other modes. The perspective should feel natural for players who like shooters or players who like MMOs. Even if you don't think you like MOBAs, Smite is different enough in a lot of ways that it might change your opinion.

reviewText: I have logged hundreds of hours before the steam release, and probably spent more than enough money on smite, but one thing stands true, after 2 years of play it is still fresh and I still return with my friends quite often. reviewText:
WHY YOU MIGHT WANT TO PLAY SMITE
- Third person, over the shoulder perspective. This is pretty big, and in my opinion, the game's biggest selling point. With one or two exceptions, abilities are all skillshots, and autoattacks have to be aimed. Direct control over your character is a much more enjoyable control scheme than click to move. (The downside to this is that you can't switch control or move the camera, so you'll never see a character like Lone Druid).
- Multiple game modes. If you like the aesthetic and controls but hate the idea of playing a traditional 3-lane 5v5 matchup, you can still hop into Arena (5v5 deathmatch. Giant circle, kill the enemy team more than they kill you), Assault (Smite's ARAM mode, 5v5 with a single lane and gods randomly assigned), Seige (4v4, two lanes with a single objective), or Joust (3v3, single lane with small jungles). There's also the Match of the Day, which can be anything from a 4v4 match on the normal 5v5 map, or Arena with 80% cooldown reduction and inifinte mana.
- Generous handouts. For $30, you can get all current and future gods. Every god has one recolor, and three mastery" skins (gold

The VGS is a convienience you won't know you're missing until you load up any other competitive game without the same level of communication tools.\n- Autobuy / Autolevel. If you don't want to sweat about what you should build or what skills you should level

reviewText:
Been playing Smite for almost 3 years now. It is awesome.
I have dabbled in many MOBAs (DoTA, LoL, Awesomenauts, Monday Night Combat) and have enjoyed all of them, but there are just a number of things that set Smite apart:

1. The theme is awesome. Ever since I played Age of Mythology as a kid I've really liked mythology as a theme. These gods are just so memorable and interesting. Smite really lets them come to life, while also introducing you to many gods you have never even heard of.

2. It's all a matter of perspective. At the end of the day, games are meant to be fun. And killing someone in Smite just feels SO MUCH MORE satisfying than it does in other MOBAs. Landing skillshots in 3rd person is much more viceral and impactful than it is in top down MOBAs.

3. Good mechanics, without cumbersome mechanics: Unlike the big two (no names needed), Smite is not cumbersome. Buying an item does not require you to know what other 4 items need to be combined to make it. Beginners can simply turn on an auto buy" feature in order to ease the learning curve. To buy stuff you just go to base and buy it. simple as that. No need for secret shops in the jungle
recommended: two core mechanics: last hitting and denial are wonderfully handled: Last hitting gives you more gold
hoursPlayed: but you also get gold for being close to enemies as they die
voteText: making farming less of a hassle. And
helpfulPercent: more importantly: there is no denial. I know some DoTA players have strong feelings about this
votesHelpful: but to me this is a no brainer: denial is a stupid mechanic and I'm glad it is out.\n\n4. The game is financially very genorous. For 30$ (20$ on steam right now
votesTotal: which is insane) you get every god in the game and every future god released. Sure
votesFunny: you can argue that the heroes in DoTA are free
commentsCount: fair enough
column16: but in comparison to LoL this is a huge upgrade. Additionally
column17: you can also easily unlock every god using in game currency. Hi Rez also very regularly has promotions where you can earn premium currency for free. And it is worth it because the skins and voicepacks in the game are AWESOME\n\n5. Speaking of Voice packs: the VGS system is amazing. Rather than wasting time typing in game
column18: a few quick button presses will inform your team about almost anything you could want to say. "Enemy missing left" "Ward the fire giant" "I'll gank right lane" "Save yourselves" "Ultimate is ready" "Chase the enemy" "Retreat left jungle" "You Rock" "Please??" etcetcetcetc. Each god
column19: and many skins have unique voicepacks
column20: making the whole thing extra cool\n\n6. Unlike most MOBAs
column21: Smite has MANY game modes and they are all popular and all worth playing. This allows me to enjoy smite with my competitive friends
column22: my noob girlfriend and my casual gamer friends. The game is balanced around conquest (the main competitive game mode with 3 lanes etc) as it should be
column23: but the other game modes get lots of love as well.\n\nIn conclusion
column24: I have played over 2000 hours of smite and look forward to playing 2000 more. 10/10

reviewText: I have 450+ Hours in the Non-Steam version, This is the first MOBA I've ever played and yes I did give League of Legends and DotA 2 a try but they just weren't for me. Smite was a wonderful MOBA that clicked with me instantly, I love the camera and how 99.9% if not all things are Skillshot meaning if you're 1v1ing a guy in lane, it's completely up to skill to decide who wins. If you enjoy MOBA's but are looking for something different than other MOBA's then Smite is worth a try! Being able to play as Gods of history like Zeus, Poseidon, Neith, Ymir, Odin, Medusa, Bellona and the list goes on and on. You have serveral different gamemodes so if you don't enjoy the tradional MOBA style'd game mode of defending lanes and destroying towers for 30 Minutes - 1 hour, Then you have fast paced Gamemodes like Arena ( Great for starters ) and MOTD's most of the time ( Mode of the day )! All in all I highly recommend Smite as a MOBA even if you didn't enjoy League of Legends or DotA 2, great helpful websites for starters would be  Smitefire [www.smitefire.com] for God builds and Guides and the Smite  Reddit page ! Hope you all have a great time playing Smite!

reviewText: Where do I begin? Okay, so I now have over 110 hours on the Steam client and had somewhere between 300-550 hours on the original client. Now, I will say that there are negative aspects to the game. However these are more particular to MOBAs in general and less about Smite. Matchmaking in League, Dota, (I assume Heroes of the Storm, but never played and never heard anything about its matchmaking) and Smite is no exception. If you're trying to teach a friend to play without making a smurf account, well, it's really REALLY hard. Since a party will always play against people around the highest party member's level, it usually results in absolute domination by the opposing team because you have at least one team mate (Being your friend you are trying to teach) who barely understands the game. This is less of a problem for experienced players of other MOBAs like LoL or Dota, however not unheard of either. The grind to level 30 is also astonishing long. I should mention that even with all this time played, I am still a level 25. I've been playing since the closed beta in October 2012. Sure, I've been playing off and on in that time, however, that doesn't change the fact that I have a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• ton of time in the game. The only reason this is a problem is that you can't play ranked until you are level 30. If you're playing a normal game in the premier" gamemode Conquest
hoursPlayed: and overall bad team players. I personally recommend that if you do play conquest
voteText: play with a friend who is on or above your skill level. If you're alone
helpfulPercent: I suggest gamemodes such as Arena and 3v3 Joust. Both are shorter games which means less time commitment and usually have more laid back people who aren't gonna wine if you end up being the first blood. This is not to say the game is bad. reviewText:
SMITE is a fun game with a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• ton of gods to choose from. From Medusa to Loki and Arachne to Zeus, these gods are balanced and all fun to play (we don't talk about Vamana.....).

The community is great, consisting of mostly friendly people (let's be honest, there's always going to be ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• people in every community). The game updates regularily, bringing us new gods quite often (which can cause a sudden storm of players to get online to get a chance to play the newest god.

I've met some great people playing SMITE and I've been friends with them for a while now. The community of SMITE is MUCH healthier than that of Leauge and DOTA, for many reasons.

If you're looking for a new game to play with other people, are interested in mythology, or want a break from DOTA or LoL, SMITE is the game for you.

Have fun and be nice!

reviewText:
TL;DR:  SMITE is an amazing MOBA with a good community and zero pay-to-win elements. 10/10.
===
I'm not good at reviews, but SMITE is an amazing game, so I'm gonna try.
SMITE is a MOBA, however it is played in a 3D enviornment from a third person view; other MOBAs are played on a 2D map from a bird's eye view. You use WASD to move around rather than clicking on a map. Every shot is a skill shot. There are quite a few game modes, all of which are very fun to play. The community is certainly not perfect, but it's far better than LoL's.
A small flaw in this game is that when a new God comes out, they will sometimes be either really bad, or really overpowered. They are always balanced within a patch or two. Items can sometimes be the same way (for example, an item called Bluestone Pendant is OP right now).
This game may appear to be pay-to-win, but it isn't. You get five Gods to start out with, one of each role. You can purchase new Gods using Favor Points"
date: which can be won by the hundreds simply by playing matches. You can also purchase the Ultimate God Pack for $30
recommended: which will give you access to all current and future Gods. When I started playing
hoursPlayed: I never felt pressured to buy a new God
voteText: as the starting five Gods were perfectly fine. The only reason I ever purchased a new God in the first place was because I wanted to try something new.\nThere is another form of in-game currency called Gems. You can earn 50 Gems by logging in 7 days in a row
helpfulPercent: adding up to a potentioal 200 Gems per month. You can also earn them by doing surveys and offers on Hi-Rez's website (I've yet to go a single day where I don't earn at least 30 Gems doing surveys). The items that you buy with Gems are 100% cosmetic: skins
votesHelpful: voice packs
votesTotal: emotes
votesFunny: etc. You can also purchase Gods with them
commentsCount: however that would be a gigantic waste since Favor Points far easier to earn.\nSMITE is easily the single best MOBA out there
column16: and I give it a 10/10."

reviewText:
Hi Rez studios has a big game changer in their hands with this title. SMITE is an insanely addicting and incredibly fun MOBA that is perfect for other players, both old and new to MOBA's, that are searching for  a new change of pace from your typical MOBA.

PROS
OVERALL - SMITE is a stupendous addition to the vastly expanding genre, and not to mention it definently stands out of the crowd. The gameplay is definently a changing factor in this than most common MOBA's.

THEME & ENVIRONMENT - The lore is absolutely astounding and gives this MOBA a beautiful environment that differs from any other. You WILL NOT get the same experience from any other MOBA.

VARIETY - SMITE also has a variety of different game modes including Arena, Joust (3v3), Conquest(5v5) and many more including a special event gamemode that changes everyday! Everyday is a new experience in SMITE.

ULTIMATE GOD PACK - This game is also one of the few that offer an Ultimate Pack" that's actually worthwhile! Tired of playing the same god all the time and don't have enough favor or gems to buy a new one? Spend $29.99USD (on sale for $20 at the day of this review) and you now have yourself every single god PAST
recommended: AND FUTURE FOREVER. To top it off
hoursPlayed:
any favor your spent on your other gods are now REFUNDED BACK excluding gems. By that time you now have every god and favor to spend on getting some sweet looking skins for all of your favorite gods!

FREE-TO-PLAY - SMITE is also one of the few FTP titles that is truly FREE TO PLAY. I love that I don't have to spend thousands of dollars or even in game time to try and grind out and get my in-game currency up to buy a new god

GOD ROTATIONS - SMITE has a function that allows you to play up to 4 new gods every week. So instead of paying favor to rent gods and try them out just wait until they're on rotation
voteText:
or just try a new god for that week. Who knows you might find your new favorite.CONS
PLAYER RANK - Reaching max player rank (Rank 30 as of this review) gives no other reward other than access to the "Ranked League Matches". You get no unlocks or rewards upon reaching this rank. I just wish they would've done more with it.

RANKED MATCHES - You cannot play a "Ranked" match until reaching the max rank of your player
helpfulPercent:
I feel as though once you reach rank 10 you should have enough experience to play a ranked match but that is sadly not the case. Even if you get placed in a low league.

NO BOOT SYSTEM - Imagine this. You're having a great time about to win a game and there is a Scylla that has no kills and 5 deaths and decides she will start feeding. There is no possible way to stop them from ruining your game unless your entire team has the skill to beat them. I hate this and wish there was a way to boot someone out of your game via a vote system but sadly there is not.
OVERALL RATING
My standpoint on SMITE is that it is definently a great MOBA with alot of amazing potential to become one of the best MOBA's out there to date. This game has made me enjoy every MOBA much more than I did before just because of its learning curve that really puts new players in a position of learning how to play this game.

Yes. There are some flaws in this game as all other games have
votesHelpful:
but for what it is I say it is definently worth picking up and trying. You will not regret it.

FINAL RATING

‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚ú© 9/10 Stars - "This is a MUST have for MOBA fans

reviewText:
Absolutely recommend.  I have played for just over a year now, and have put nearly 900 hours in it.  Smite is a 3rd person MOBA.  If the MOBA aspect is a turn-off, there's a very popular 5v5 deathmatch-like gamemode, and a total of 6 different modes (including a special mode of the day, often with different rules) that all can appeal to different players.
In this game, all the characters are gods from different mythological pantheons (Greek, Roman, Norse, Hindu, Chinese, Mayan...likely a new pantheon next year).  Each character has just 3 standard abilities, and a passive, then one ultimate ability.  There's really only just a few ways to make them work together.  It's when you combine those with your team, and work around your opponent's abilities when it gets fun.  The gameplay feels really rewarding when you do something awesome with all of this.

Excellent free-to-play model.  You get 5 base characters, and each week, a rotating set of 5 free characters.  You can rent new characters really cheaply (with in-game currency) to try them out (you can try them free in Jungle Practice Mode).  There are a few gods that are priced below the standard 5500 favor, and you can unlock a few through social media promotions.  Depending on how often you play, you might be able to get one new god each week.
However, I will reccommend the Ultimate God Pack.  It is undoubtedly the best pay" deal in all MOBAs. For $30 (AND IT'S ON SALE FOR $20 THIS WEEK...best deal in gaming)
date: you unlock all 69+ gods (and if you spent favor to buy some beforehand
recommended: you get it back) plus all future gods.\nThe paid in-game currency (gems) is used for cosmetic god skins

so you can save up and continue playing for free if you have a skin you really want.
There are also ~monthly promotions where you get free gems for each first win in each game mode.

I really like the Voice-Guided System

reviewText:
I have played Smite since the closed beta and have sunk almost a thousand hours into it prior to the Steam release.

Smite is a quickly growing Third-Person action oriented Moba that puts an interesting spin on the genre that is not just a gimmick to attract short term players.
The methods of control are more (WASD and Third-Person Camera) are far more intuitive than other games in the genre if you have played any other Third-Person action game before.
Smite also offers a variety of more casual game modes, combined with the intuitive controls this lowers the barrier of entry significantly, making it a great game for people that want to get into the Moba genre but are afraid of the steep learning curve most games have.

Despite of it's friendly early learning curve Smite has a huge skill ceiling and offers much at an endgame level. Apart from more common Moba skills, like map awareness and tactical awareness, Smite also requires you to hit much more skillshots than other Mobas, which makes it interesting for more serious players, potentially with a background in shooter games

Pros
friendly learning curve
intuitive controls
good tutorials for new players
Ultimate god pack (all current and future gods for one price)
casual game modes
high skill ceiling
skillshots
interesting god design
growing e-sports scene
A lot of these cons are technical and will hopefully be resolved soon

Cons
bad matchmaking
bad servers (a persistent issue that keeps coming and going again)
annyoing idiots (like every Moba, Smite sadly hasn't been able to get rid of this)
Who is this game for?:
Anyone who is interested in the Moba genre and is looking for a more casual experience.
Anyone who is looking for a familiar control scheme and more skillshots.
Anyone who wants to play a competitive Moba with a different design.

reviewText: Smite is a Free To Play 3rd person action MOBA that centers around ancient gods competing against eachother.  Want to watch Sun Wukong put a beating down on Odin?  No problem.  Want to watch Loki stab Aphroditie in the back?  Done deal.  Want to see Zeus electrify everyone and everything?  Most definately.  With the $30 godpack available, you can have all gods at your fingertips for the most reasonable price in MOBA history.  I have personally put more time into this game than any other (I've only had Smite on my Steam for about a month), which says a lot considering I have massive game ADD.  Try this game, but like most MOBAS, don't get discouraged if you have a few bad matches.  Go to the reddit for beginners guides, ask your teammates for help, and ignore the haters.  A must own if you have any skill with a mouse and keyboard.  (controller supported as well)

All I can say smite is toxic most of the time. But it's still my top favorite because of various memories I had.

10/10

reviewText:
So here is my Review on Smite
(now understand i have played LoL, Dota2,  and heroes of the storm so I'm not new to MOBA's but i am new to Smite)

Now after the tutorial i joinid my first real match and my team destroyed, i expected the other team to spam chat how they should have won and who made them lose and what did they do call a gg and said good work to me for how i played for a beginier I stepped away with my mind blown that there was no ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing about how they lost and who made them lose.BY FAR THE BEST MOBA COMMUNITE I HAVE EVER SEEN. Dota the vets can be ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•s to you and there is always that one kid who gets real ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• he lost. LoL is the same thing but more Blaming eachother. Heroes of the Storm came close with every now and again that one control freak who gets ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• when you don't listen to him.There is also the disconnecting system unlike Dota with it's a bot will take over until he recconects well in this in a Co-op match against bots if someone leaves on your team they just remove one Bot from the enmy team during other matches however there is no system for a bot to take over but i do feel like there is some kind of equalizing system in place to enhance the teammissing one or more men down.

Now the Third person aiming mechanic works a lot better then the previous MOBAs that did similar. Replacing the classic point and click you get a better control of your character I feel then Dota and LoL. With the aiming of your basic attack mechanic i feel that it doesn't give players a great edge like in Dota how your ranged character at about mid range never missed with there basic attack.Smite you can hide behind your grunts and use them like basic attack shields. Skills I feel have changed thanks to the third person aiming, Such as Sun Wukong the monkey king a playable character in Smite has a skill that transforms him into three seprate creatures the creature he becomes depends on how far you aim the attack, Again giving a strong since of control.

Finally is the items, Now the items Range from a lot of different stat boosts from a Speed Buff to Magic damgae buff but unlike Dota were you only get cash from killing a minion our enemy you get cash and EXP for assists as well in Smite. Plus unlike Dota with it's Items that can make a character stupidly strong our make others seem really week in comparison Smite has a balanced choice of items that won't make you want to give up half way throught.

Well thats my review I have wasted enought time on writing this and I would perfer to get back to playing this game is by far in my opinion a 10/10 IGN would bang again

reviewText:
I have just recently added Smite to Steam even though I played this game for over 1k hours in the last year or so. As far as MOBAS go, I believe only Dota 2 comes ahead of Smite. Smite is certainly simpler and easier to get into. It is quite fun and engaging right off the bat. And, yes, it takes some skill to get good and be an efficient team player. The last hit rewards gold to all makes it so it needs less micromanaging but, at the end of the day, someone in the team will be building stacks and will be keen to last hitting, which is pretty easy anyway. The god (hero) pool is quite large and varied, and mastery of any god in Smite takes only a few games. The quality of the graphics and character detail are excellent. The games are often shorter than other MOBAs, maybe with the exception of HoTS, as there are many casual games modes, all different from each other. The main mode (the league conquest) is still the most enjoyable, in my opinion. Getting to play ranked games is much faster than in Dota 2. As far as the community goes, well, there are plenty of kids playing the game, as it is logical, and there is no real banning system from Hi Rez (I have never seen anyone banned from a report). So, imagine. Kids will do what kids do (you know the drill - rage quit, place the blame on others, take no reponsibility, no patience, gratutitous insults, bullying). Thankfully you can mute people, similarly to Dota 2. However, the games being a bit more action packed early that in Dota 2, the raging usually starts right away. There is less of that getting comfortable on your hero during early stages of the game than in Dota 2.

All and all, Smite is a great game, truly free to play, which rewards good individual and team play. You can progress in this game spending no money (or very little if you want to support Hi Rez) and acquire all sorts of gear.

The pro community is small but watching their games is engaging. There are plenty of pro players with a healthy streaming schedule. The casters do a good job most of the time, even though they should start dropp√¨ng the education" component from their casting
date: as the viewing community is well versed in the game by now.\n\nIn conclusion
recommended: play the game and check the community out. Start with a few gods
hoursPlayed: master these and see what role you like. The rest will work itself out."

reviewText: Such a great MOBA. reviewText: Where do I begin? Okay, so I now have over 110 hours on the Steam client and had somewhere between 300-550 hours on the original client. Now, I will say that there are negative aspects to the game. However these are more particular to MOBAs in general and less about Smite. Matchmaking in League, Dota, (I assume Heroes of the Storm, but never played and never heard anything about its matchmaking) and Smite is no exception. If you're trying to teach a friend to play without making a smurf account, well, it's really REALLY hard. Since a party will always play against people around the highest party member's level, it usually results in absolute domination by the opposing team because you have at least one team mate (Being your friend you are trying to teach) who barely understands the game. This is less of a problem for experienced players of other MOBAs like LoL or Dota, however not unheard of either. The grind to level 30 is also astonishing long. I should mention that even with all this time played, I am still a level 25. I've been playing since the closed beta in October 2012. Sure, I've been playing off and on in that time, however, that doesn't change the fact that I have a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• ton of time in the game. The only reason this is a problem is that you can't play ranked until you are level 30. If you're playing a normal game in the premier" gamemode Conquest
hoursPlayed: and overall bad team players. I personally recommend that if you do play conquest
voteText: play with a friend who is on or above your skill level. If you're alone
helpfulPercent: I suggest gamemodes such as Arena and 3v3 Joust. Both are shorter games which means less time commitment and usually have more laid back people who aren't gonna wine if you end up being the first blood. This is not to say the game is bad. The game is a downright amazing game that I would recommend to almost anyone. The players themselves are the bad part. This isn't even mentioning the totally awesome concept of playing as freaking GODS. "Oh
votesHelpful: so you're saying that in this game I can murder Zeus with Thor
votesTotal: proving my dominance as the best god of thunder? SIGN ME UP!"\nTL;DR\nThis is a free to play game with an awesome concept
votesFunny: awesome gameplay mechanics
commentsCount: and provides you with an awesome time. Play the game. There is actually no reason not to give it a go."

reviewText:
Scroll down past the paragraph for TL;DR!

This game is an amazing MOBA. Definitely better than the more mainstream MOBAS (looking at you, DOTA 2 / League of Legends). Most MOBAs tend to bore me and infuriate me, but this one doesn't feel like a MOBA and that you're more in control than the click-fest the other MOBAs bring - plus the community is INFINITELY less toxic than other MOBAs (mainly because toxic behavior is not tolerated by HiRez or most of the players). Instead of an RTS stand-point, it uses a 3rd person action perspective. The gods are all fairly unique and they all have the potential to be amazing and game changing while focusing on teamwork and strategy. The nice thing about this game is that you don't really have to pay a single penny to play and it's not pay to win. The company is actually good enough to award you with their premium currency for daily log-ins (days 6 & 7), and with tons of events. I would suggest to get the Ultimate God Pack since you'll receive all 71 gods PLUS every single god that comes after this, and with the Japanese gods coming by on January 2016 (other pantheons include Roman, Greek, Egyptian, Chinese, Mayan, Hindu and Norse gods), it is an amazing investment (especially on this Thanksgiving weekend and periodically where they discount it at 33% off) and the premium currency can get you cool skins, voice packs among other cool stuff.

In conclusion: This game is a must have for anyone who likes MOBAs or actually dislikes the traditional MOBAs (like I did), but wants to give the genre one more chance.

reviewText: I hate MOBAs. I tried LoL, DOTA, and several other lesser known games. I picked this up earlier this month, and immediately became addicted. My friends, who hate MOBAs as much as I do, also became addicted. We now have our own small clan and play this game daily.\n\nNot sure what it is about the change of perspective from isometric click-to-move to third person WASD controls that makes such a difference to me, but now I can say I genuinely enjoy a MOBA. The community isn't quite as toxic, either, so that's a plus.

reviewText:
Great game! Top down wasd movement. Very fun, easy to spend hours on end playing Smite.

Until recently I would hae told you that the community is nothing like that of League of Legands, everyone is very friendly and supportive but I have been running into more and more people who just seem to be uncooporative just for the sake of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• people off just like LoL.

I will still say however, that your run into less people who dont know how to play. It seems like in Smite people are smart enough to atleast play bots until they figure out a champion before playing online in matches with other people ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• their team off by feeding.

In general though Id certainly recommend smite to anyone looking at it. Its free to play, there is no pay to win, but you can invest in different skins or cosmetic items if that's you thing. Very fun, most of the community is really nice, and they keep adding new content constantly like new champions, skins, items, and random event games.

reviewText: SMITE is a free unique MOBA that consists of gods fighting each other. With the new addition of the Japanese goddess Amaterasu, they now have eight pantheons, Japanese, Chinese, Hindu, Roman, Greek, Mayan, Egyptian, and Norse. What makes SMITE unique is it's 3rd person camera angle and moving with WASD, compared to the aerial view and point and click MOBA's like LoL and DOTA. SMITE also is quick to learn, and you'll be playing with the big boys in no time. Overall SMITE has a very good feel to it and the camera angle and WASD movement make this game better than other MOBA's, this is easily a 9/10 game.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
I say other games like DotA Allstars, Dota2 and Heroes of the storm that I've played are all great games and deserve 9/10. (And other dota-like games that I didn't mention are just shadowed by Dota2) But they aren't as action-packed, aren't as visually polished as SMITE; their ranged attack can't be dodged or blocked; their combat field / lane / jungle are smaller, more crowded with incommensurately large model of characters and spells; their heroes have eyes in the back of their heads.

For example, I think Dota2's artwork is great. The other day, I roomed in and found out a man are almost as high as a tree and the landscape is just non existent, I'm so disappointed that I suddenly found out I'm just not playing an AAA game.

For the action-packed, juking and vision part. Go google SMITE top 5 plays casted by Inuki and one will feel the thrill that other mouse-clicking dota won't give. Just remember, when one dashes forward in SMITE, he/she will see everything moving backward and will have effective vision field shrinking. Compared to the more boring 360 degree vision field of most other dota games, one only have part" of "720" degrees in SMITE.

I said other popular dota-like games are great
date: but the comparison is cruel. So either 6/10 to them and 9/10 to SMITE. Or
hoursPlayed: then 9/10 to them and 15/10 to SMITE. Deal with it."

reviewText: So i've been playing Smite since Alpha and have probably over thousand hours played and i must say it's amazingly fun and it's the only moba i play so that speaks for itself. It's good that they keep adding skins and new stuff to the game but unfortunately old issues still remain and one of that is the fps drop. This is one of the most unoptimized games i've played it's not that bad but when i compare it to let's say BF 4 things start to get really odd during matches i get 30-40 fps max (bare in mind everything is in low) and on BF 4 i get over 60 fps on medium. And that's one of the main reasons why i don't play it that often. Other issues include god balancing there are some really overpowered gods mostly the new ones (it's a consumer trick) every new god they relesease it's op so that you can buy him with money or with favor (igc). All in all if you can run Smite with good framerate and you are not easily agitated then i recommend it but if you have old pc or easily agitated i don't recommend it.

reviewText: Season 3 of Smite ranked is coming up, and i really recommend players start playing smite for this new season. The game is really entertaining and competetive, except for the occacional games where you run into people who dont speak a word of English at all, and don't know a thing about the game. Other than those people, this game is extreamly fun to play with friends, and if youre interested in learning about gods from different pantheons, it makes the game even more fun. You can also get all current and future gods in the game for a really good price. The good number of playable gods in the game makes no game alike, and the fact that there are 6 gamemodes to play, including the daily changing MOTD, which adds an even more fun twist to the normal gamemodes, such as being able to fire off all ablities at 80% lower cooldown then usual, without having to deplete your mana. I recommend this game to all players that have some knowledge of the english language, since you probably wont be able to meet any other players to play with if you dont.

All in all this is the best MOBA I have ever played.

JUST PLAY IT AND YOU WILL SEE!

reviewText: SMITE is a 3rd person moba. Simple? Simple. Well, your 3rd person viewpoint in this game is a lot different. Unlike HoTS, League of Legends, or Dota 2, SMITE does not use its same camera angle, and instead is directed behind the god you are controlling. SMITE has characters from different cultures such as Greek gods like Apollo and Artemis, or Chinese gods like Ne Zha and Huo Yi. Gameplay is very different from other mobas because you are viewing from a different angle, making skillshots feel very different than before if you have played from the LoL/Dota 2/HoTS viewpoint. Also, autoattacks are aimed too, making last hitting for gold or pushing more satisfying. Now, onto my opinion.\n\nPersonally, I really enjoy this game and very surprised I didn't try this game out earlier. This game has very satisfying and refreshing gameplay, and the gods have very fun kits to play around with. Personally, I found that my favorite assassin right now has to be Bastet. Don't look over this game if you are trying to looking for a new free-to-play game to try out, because you won't be disapppointed at all.

reviewText:
I just added this game to my Steam library but I have played SMite for well over 1000+ hours. I have played DOTA, HOS and LOL and other the HOS I quickly got feed up with the isometric style of MOBA.

First off Smites biggest selling point is that it is in 3rd person. That is a game changer. It is more responsive and the action is so much faster. Also the cosmetic skins are amazing and have only gotten better and better. Not only that Hi Rez updates the skins of old Gods over time.

I spend most of my time playing Arena and although I play Conquest, Arena is so much more fun for me. I main Ymir and Ares both 10 mastery, it is the first time I have found myself truly enjoying a support, tank roll in any game ever. Also support matters and can carry if you are good enough. Knowing every role can shine.

The game is free so there is simply not a reason to try it. Also the Ultimate God pack gives you access to all present and future Gods. I was salty that they have offered this deal post Beta but you know what, it brings in more players and that is great for Smite. Had Smite launched before or at the same time as DOTA or LOL it would be the number on MOBA in the world.

Two more points, Tribes is getting an update because of Smite, the game many claim killed Tribes. Hi Rez needs to make money and no game developers do no exist simply to cater to entitled gamers. Smite has been so sucessful that Hi rez can divert resources to do just that and has. Secondly Hi Rez is constantly doing in game events for gems which you use to by skins and voice packs as well as Gods. Never use gems for Gods because you can use the free currency to do that. Use your gems for skins and voice packs.

I recommend this game as fully as I could ever recommend anything. If you find COnquest getting you down try Arean and yes it is okay to only play that and MOTD. It is your game time so your rules. Please join me in Smite it is a bannar time.

reviewText: As someone who has played LOL, DOTA2 and HOTS, SMITE is by far one of my favorite MOBA's. reviewText:
Probably the only MOBA that I actually enjoy. It might be the 3rd person camera, or the fact that I can play 5v5 Arena instead of just lane-pushing, but whatever the reason I really do like this game. Which is suprising because my initial time spent with it, before it came to Steam, didn't exactly grab my attention.

That aside, there's not much different here from LoL or DOTA; same general mechanics, same gameplay (save the perspective).

The difference is that the learning curve isn't as high. It's still there, don;t get me wrong, and some Gods take a lot of skill/practice to play and not end up with no kills and double digit deaths. But it's not *as* high as a lot of other MOBAs. The community is mostly silent, from what I've seen, so it's not as toxic to ne players as something like LoL where if you ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• up you're getting yelled at by 12 year olds. You still get idiots saying stupid things, but not as often.

My only advice for new players is to buy the Ultimate God Pack DLC. For $20-30 USD you get every God in the game, plus any new ones they add. This saves grinding so you can use all your Favors (in game currency) on skins for the Gods you like instead.

reviewText:
Smite is an amazing game, certainly one of my top five picks for a good pc game. The graphics are well done, and you can explore a whole new universe of different mythologies. I have logged in so much hours into this game. I know steam says I'm lying but, I've been in before  the beta was almost over. Here are some pros and cons

Pro
- graphics  are well done
- good selection  of God's or Champions
-unique  modes/ maps
-alright user interface
-friendly to new players
-abilities match with each gods lore. Found that to be cool
-e sport teams are popular
-unique 3rd - person perspective
-new gods constantly being added to the roster

Cons
-the community is soo toxic, trolls everywhere wanting to make your day a living hell
- hi-rez servers are random
-god balancing is very broken. Hi-res can't make up their  minds on how to nerf or buff a god.
-not alot of variety  in item builds to the five roles.
- did I forget to mention the community will make you kill yourself.
- Alot of bugs that need fixing
-heard from alot of people that, old accounts that are being integrated into steam and having alot of troubles.
-steam achievements dont unlock if you play the game before           (‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• me off because I should have all of them)
-hi-rez will do anything for your money. Aka over priced in game items and skins
- you need the god pack to actually  enjoy the full game....

All in all, Smite is a great game to play. But the community  is sooo toxic. Most new players will.probably quit because of hard core smite fanatic s". You can't play ranked without someone trolling. But I have hope for the community to smarten  up lol. Hope this helps.
"

reviewText:
I have had this game downloaded way before it came on steam, and this game is my life.
- Pros and cons
(Pros):
- Diffrent from all other mobas
- Third person veiw making it very action feeling
- Tons of Gods to choose from (Currently 71 Gods from 7 diffirent Pantheons Japanese/Shinto is in next update)
- Mostly good community
- Fun and exciting
- Easy to pick up Difficult to master
- Not GPU intense

(Cons)
- Some players will be ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• (People who autolock is a pain)
- Some players wont know how to listen or comunicate with team
- Latency issues somedays not usually that bad
- minor texture glitches (usually fixed in a patch that next week)
- Can be very time consuming (Like all mobas)
- Some gods are getting nerfed and then boosted (Like they cant find a even ground)

Fun things to try
- Build some characters weird and experiment (Like a guardian playing as jungle)
- Buy some skins some change the whole way the god feels
- Play practice mode and kick some bots butt
- Say you dont know how to play then get the best K/D

Tips
- Be flexible learn to play atleast one god for each spot
- Practice practice practice (Play practice first to know whats the best way to build your god and what moves to lvl)
- Turn off auto buy and auto lvl skills (Some skills you may wanna level up first)
- Look around the store and learn items
- Dont watch pro's play whatever makes you win
- Take advice if a teammate notice something
- FOR THE LOVE OF GOD PLEASE USE VOICE COMMANDS

Should you buy it?
Its free but Gems and ultimate god pack are not
(Ultimate god pack is a fantastic deal youll never get bored)

reviewText:
I have 500 hours I've played this before it came to steam and but this is easily my favorite MOBA out there by far.

Mini desc.
SMITE is a MOBA that competes with the other major ones (LoL, DOTA) and in my experiance, does a lot of stuff better.
It has a third person angle instead of the usual Top-Down camera, which to me makes those games feel a lot more like a RTS. Because of this it feels way more action based and almost all abilities/auto attacks are skill based aim.
I prefer the regular Conquest map (3 lanes, jungle in between, 5 roles for you and your team to play) game mode but they have something for everyone! They have a total of 5 game modes + special one of the day, and a 6th you can access in custom games that was taken out.
There is currently 69 gods and they come out with new ones reletively fast! I'd say about 1 every 2 months give or take. Frequent patches to adjust balance and all that good stuff.

Pros.
+Third person
+Learning curve isn't as steep as other MOBAs
+Deep competitive play
+Many gamemodes
+Frequent Patches
+69 characters at time of writing this review
+Has a much better community then LoL or DOTA in my experiance
+Pretty cool theme of ancient gods battling it out
+Servers rarely lag but I live close to them
+Has casual and competitive modes
+There is a esports community, last world tournament having prizepool of 2.6 million $
+Indie company that made it, cares about it's game

Cons.
-When a new god comes out they tend to be unbalanced for the first 2 weeks.
-because it's a teambased game, if a teamate disconnects it can screw you over.
-toxic teamates are annoying.

Final thoughts.
The idea of abunch of ancient gods from Egyptian, Chinese, Hindu, Norse, Greek, Roman mythology battling it out is awesome. I highly recomend this game.

reviewText:
Hi-Rez Studios‚Äô free-to-play Smite occupies an interesting space in a genre that‚Äôs going to see a deluge of new titles in 2014. Most multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) titles feature top-down, isometric action, but Smite gives players the chance to play in third-person with a first-person shooter feel. Even auto-attacks are skillshots, making combat feel different from other MOBAs. Smite also features significant mode variety, allowing players to compete in unique deathmatches or themed games.

Smite puts you in the role of an ancient god; the character pool currently draws upon Greek, Norse, Chinese, Mayan, and more, allowing Hi-Rez a nearly infinite pool of flavorful characters with appropriate abilities. Thanatos can sense death and has a skillset focused on assassination, paired with an ultimate ability that allows him to execute a weakened player in a single, long-range dive. Zeus comes with all the powers you‚Äôd expect a thunder god to have, and Poseidon has the signature ability to ‚Äúrelease the Kraken,‚Äù doing heavy AOE damage. The colorful cast of characters is interesting, and each god and goddess feels unique in terms of skillsets and style.

Smite‚Äôs third-person design changes things significantly from the top-down isometric MOBA paradigm. Every attack requires skill, so you can‚Äôt just rely on auto-attack to do your work. Everything from the basic slash of an axe or magic from a stave needs to be carefully timed and aimed in order to land. The range of each move is generally shown after a skill has been highlighted, and then you direct it to land in a specific area. Smite presents a huge change from games that often have ‚Äúclick-aimed‚Äù skills and abilities, and each character has specific nuances to master.

Smite features a classic competitive mode that mirrors the structure of the go-to MOBA map: creeps spawn in three lanes and are assisted by players pushing, ganking, and team-fighting to the opposing base. Smite also has an all-random, all-middle mode that is becoming more popular in MOBA titles. While the standard mode is certainly the go-to for competitive league play and balance, Smite‚Äôs Arena and custom modes make it stand out from competitors

reviewText:
>>>>____FYI > The reviews of this game will be skewered, since any that get even a single thumbs up get linked to their official page which obviously has all the fanboys rating down anything negative and uprating any that are positive.<<<<_____

This game has a lot of potential and love the look with the close up style and over the shoulder view compared to your average moba with overhaed views. HOWEVER, it has the worst AI coding i have ever seen in a moba. Most dont care since they are only in it for the online play, but since I play with my young daughter that is all we play and was important to me.

Of the 70+ available gods they only programmed about 8 or so in total. If you play joust (3vs3) you will play vs the same 3 every game, unless you use one of the ones the cpu wants, then it will use the same ones 2-3x making your match trivially easy to build gear for. Same goes for arena where i see the same god used for all 5 opponents at times.

If you play co-op conquest (5vs5) or clash (4vs4) the enemy will also pick the same gods every single game that will go down the same lanes every single time. If your team doesnt fill up in under 1min it will give you ai teammates that are so bad, that my daughter outplays them every single game (not joking). You are teamed with the same ones every single game, and they are horri-bad.

I have played around 20 games with Kali and Sobek as teammates and I have never in all those games seen either of them get even a single kill. They wont push lanes and you will see them just sitting behind your phoenix and watching it die.

Despite the lack of intelligence in the ai the game is still pretty fun and would still reccommend but not as highly as if they had put more effort into getting more ai up to snuff.

The community is usually pretty good in game, but on steam forums quite the opposite. Probably the most toxic collection of people I have ever wasted my time talking to. Most have run out of ritalin and are so bored they argue with you over literally any comment you make. Pretty much any thread on there about anything has the Git gud" crowd chiming in thinking that its still pretty original and funny.

Think your god is op and boring? "Git Gud"

Cant log in? "Git Gud"

Dont like this review? "Git Gud""

reviewText:
It's League of Legends for people who hate League of Legends, basically.

Pros:
- Community isn't -as- toxic as LoL
- 3rd Person POV is pretty unique for an MOBA
- Not pay-to-win (Though the Ult. God Pack is an awesome deal)
- Have you seen the goddesses (and other models)? Absolutely gorgeous (most of them, at least)
- No, I don't just mean Neith's rack that she loves to shake around
- Fairly easy to earn Favor/Gems for new gods or skins

Cons:
- Some of the skins are less than gorgeous
- Community is still toxic
- If you're -not- into rack-shaking...
- I hear the Customer Service is pretty bad, but I don't know from personal experience
- Some gods feel completely useless, others are incredibly overpowered, some are simply too complicated (or simply too simple) - tl;dr please balance out ur gods better hi-rez

Overall, coming from someone who loathes LoL and other MOBAs like it, I love SMITE. It feels more like an RPG-style PVP than it does an MOBA, and the lore behind all the Gods/Goddesses is a really neat aspect that a lot of MOBAs are missing nowadays (I'm looking at YOU, League of Legends).

reviewText: After constantly getting frustrated with League of Legends, I found Smite. Smite is a very rewarding game, in that you are able to progress with each character you select. Getting my first level 10 mastery for a god was a very happy day, as I was able to see the work I put into getting to that point. You can buy the skins and chests in the game by simply logging in daily and playing for favor, but sometimes you need to pay if you really want a nice skin. The seasonal events are great and rewarding. You feel more in control of your character in this third person action MOBA, rather than a top-down style. I'd say, give it a try, and you may just get hooked.

reviewText:
If this is the first time that you as a player has considered playing a MOBA, than I welcome you to your first and only stop on the genre. SMITE is a game that has made a name for it's self as a fun place to play, expand, grow, and develop.
The game itself is very friendly for new comers (both to the genre and to the game), and great for more experienced hands.
The game is entirely free to play; you only pay for something with real money if you are so desired. But even then you receive rewards for actively playing and accomplishing quests.
The UI is user friendly, most players are willing to help. The only thing that you have/should do is look into what your character can do, and play to your strengths. As well as your teams'.

reviewText:
Scroll down past the paragraph for TL;DR!

This game is an amazing MOBA. Definitely better than the more mainstream MOBAS (looking at you, DOTA 2 / League of Legends). Most MOBAs tend to bore me and infuriate me, but this one doesn't feel like a MOBA and that you're more in control than the click-fest the other MOBAs bring - plus the community is INFINITELY less toxic than other MOBAs (mainly because toxic behavior is not tolerated by HiRez or most of the players). Instead of an RTS stand-point, it uses a 3rd person action perspective. The gods are all fairly unique and they all have the potential to be amazing and game changing while focusing on teamwork and strategy. The nice thing about this game is that you don't really have to pay a single penny to play and it's not pay to win. The company is actually good enough to award you with their premium currency for daily log-ins (days 6 & 7), and with tons of events. I would suggest to get the Ultimate God Pack since you'll receive all 71 gods PLUS every single god that comes after this, and with the Japanese gods coming by on January 2016 (other pantheons include Roman, Greek, Egyptian, Chinese, Mayan, Hindu and Norse gods), it is an amazing investment (especially on this Thanksgiving weekend and periodically where they discount it at 33% off) and the premium currency can get you cool skins, voice packs among other cool stuff.

In conclusion: This game is a must have for anyone who likes MOBAs or actually dislikes the traditional MOBAs (like I did), but wants to give the genre one more chance.

reviewText: I ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing love this MOBA, this is the only MOBA that I can get into. I feel as if it takes a bit more skill than most of the others which are basically a button mashing fest. Sure they're pros and cons to every game developed, but out of all the MOBA's or even out of the nearly 150 games I have I pick this one the majority of the time to play. I only wish the achievements and hours transferred over from the original client launcher instead of me having to get them all again for Steam, that's my only CON so far. Because I have damn near all of them in game and roughly 200+ hours put into this game and the only MOBA I like paying for skins. They put some DAMN GOOD detail into the skins as well as the voice packs to go with those skins.\n\nAlso if you get hooked on the game get the ultimate god pack, if it's still out, it's TOTALLY worth it. All of my hamer friends I tell about this game and I've gotten several hooked on Smite. I love it and so do they. I would HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone. It's fun queing up solo or a group.

reviewText: Played Smite before it came to steam, very enjoyable for someone who couldn't really take to MOBA's such as LoL or Dota. The community is less toxic but nevertheless you will always get the odd few who are literally mental and take the game way too seriously. I'd recommend this to people who are looking for a new fun game to play and pass the time, but i'd stick to modes like arena and joust before you head into conquest. Like i said, ive been playing this game for a long time and I still don't play conquest because its usually taken way to seriously. Matchmaking recently has been quite terrible, fingers crossed that **** gets fixed soon!

Because Bellona is hot.

Ok seriously, the game is streight forward and fun, game is fairly balanced, looks decently good, and community is less toxic.

Jungle monsters have their own idol and ready stances, which is very cute btw.

I played only very little Dota2 so I don't compare the game with it, but to LoL...lol...good bye

reviewText: Smite is great moba. Probably better than LoL and Dota 2 because they have more toxic communities and especially in case of riot games they dont ue the power they have over their game correctly. I played the smite beta and since then it has improved drasticly. If you wont to have a full experience buy the all god pack and starter pack which both have really good value. In terms of skins its the most creative of the mobas.\nThe new 3rd person perspective compared to the overview perspective of the other mobas is a good change ut also limits the abilities they can add a lot and the originality of new gods added to the games. The amount of skills that are cones straight lines and circles around the gods make different gods very similar.\nWhen i got into this gamei realised i stomped everyone because i had alrady played other mobas. I Highly recommended for already moba players, new to mobas may have a bad experience because you need to know the basic concepts and not trat it like team deathmatch where you can die without impact.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Amazing!

I absolutely love this game! It's so exciting, interesting and it's got so much fun! I can recommend playing it with friends. It's a game where you learn how to make good tactics with your friends, and that brings players together. It's a game where you have to build up a strategy to make the best/strongest team of Gods, which I like. I like how you start from the bottom and have to work to the top.

Bad things:
I actually don't have any complains about this game at all. I think it's only fair that some skins can only be achieved with gems. It makes me want to play even more to unlock them.

Good things:
I like the different God styles and the skins that you can achieve to them. It's great that not every kind of skin cost gems, as it would have turned out to be boring in the end. If I'd have to go through an awfully lot to get every single gem in the game, I'd probably stop playing it after some time. I think the game's quiet easy to play, and the rules are easy to relate to. It's not too hard and it's not too easy, that's how I like games. It makes me focus on training my Gods, which is the whole point of SMITE. x3 I also like the kickout system that kicks inactive players out of the arena or the different multiplayer games. It's fair, as a team should work together. They depend on each other, in my opinion.

So my conlcusion is: This game is amazingly good, if you like tactics, multiplayer games and Gods! x3 I can definitely recommend it!

reviewText:
I have played Smite since the closed beta and have sunk almost a thousand hours into it prior to the Steam release.

Smite is a quickly growing Third-Person action oriented Moba that puts an interesting spin on the genre that is not just a gimmick to attract short term players.
The methods of control are more (WASD and Third-Person Camera) are far more intuitive than other games in the genre if you have played any other Third-Person action game before.
Smite also offers a variety of more casual game modes, combined with the intuitive controls this lowers the barrier of entry significantly, making it a great game for people that want to get into the Moba genre but are afraid of the steep learning curve most games have.

Despite of it's friendly early learning curve Smite has a huge skill ceiling and offers much at an endgame level. Apart from more common Moba skills, like map awareness and tactical awareness, Smite also requires you to hit much more skillshots than other Mobas, which makes it interesting for more serious players, potentially with a background in shooter games

Pros
friendly learning curve
intuitive controls
good tutorials for new players
Ultimate god pack (all current and future gods for one price)
casual game modes
high skill ceiling
skillshots
interesting god design
growing e-sports scene
A lot of these cons are technical and will hopefully be resolved soon

Cons
bad matchmaking
bad servers (a persistent issue that keeps coming and going again)
annyoing idiots (like every Moba, Smite sadly hasn't been able to get rid of this)
Who is this game for?:
Anyone who is interested in the Moba genre and is looking for a more casual experience.
Anyone who is looking for a familiar control scheme and more skillshots.
Anyone who wants to play a competitive Moba with a different design.

SMITE is fun, even if you arent usualy into MOBAs i can guarantee you WILL, and i repeat, WILL enjoy this game.

i give this game a 9.5/10
